texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres microempresarias una de ellas es Adelfa que vende cosméticos de la Avon desde hace 7 años,  es soltera y madre de dos hijos. El crédito invertirá en la compra de cosméticos como perfume de varón y perfume de mujer, crema para manos, crema para cuerpo, lociones, etc. Marbely su negocio es de una librería y Gema vende ropa usada.
texts.en: This group comprises three micro-entrepreneurs, one of whom is Adelfa who has been selling Avon cosmetics for the past 7 years. She is a single mother with two children. She will invest the loan in the purchase of cosmetics such as cologne and perfume, hand cream, body lotion and other creams, etc. Marbelly runs a bookshop and Gema sells second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy Avon cosmetics, such as hand cream, body lotion, cologne and perfume, etc.

loans.name: Mama Simona Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Mama Simona” en la ciudad del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de comestibles, venta de helados, crianza de animales menores, venta de jora y otras.  

Mauricia nació en el distrito de Poroy  de la provincia del Cusco y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació, ella tiene 44 años, tiene una relación  de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, leche, gaseosas, golosinas y entres otros.

 Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends started the communal bank "Mama Simona" in the city of Cusco. This communal bank is composed of people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead in life and that strive every day to give their children a better future. The bank’s members have different lines of work, such as food sales, ice cream sales, raising farm animals and jewelry sales.

Mauricia is 44, and was born in the district of Poroy, Cusco province, where she still lives. She lives in a common-law marriage and has three children. She runs a small grocery store at home. This time, she is requesting a loan to buy supplies, such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, milk, beverages, and candies. The bank’s members appreciate the opportunity given and promise to pay the installments in time.

Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco, department of Cusco. It lies in the heart of the ancient Inca city and is known for its touristic attractions, its archaeological centers, its historic center, and its landscapes and history. All these things make Cusco an enchanting city, in the south of the country. Cusco is a well-known touristic and commercial destination and is famous for its traditional Inti Raymi celebration and because it has one of the world’s seven modern wonders, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store, such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, beverages and candies.

loans.name: Josefa De La Cruz

texts.es: Josefa es una microempresaria que desde hace 15 años se dedica a vender tortillas en un mercado de la capital, frijoles cocidos, cuajaditas, es madre casada con dos hijos quienes le ayudan a trabajar en el negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, cuajaditas, frijoles y leñas.
texts.en:
Josefa is a micro-entrepreneur who has been selling tortillas for the past 15 years. She sells them in a market in the capital. She also sells cooked beans and milk curds.

She is married and has two children who help her out with the business. She will invest the loan in the purchase of maize, curds, beans and firewood.

loans.use: to buy maize, curds, beans and firewood

loans.name: Nimia Eliceth

texts.es:
La señora Nimia   de  44 años de edad, es soltera,  tiene  un   hijo  que depende de ella, se dedica desde hace 21  años al negocio de venta de frescos, pollo, embutidos, agua en bolsa, churros, dulces, verduras, cosméticos, granos básicos y pan, está ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Doña Nimia es una mujer que ha trabajado duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos y su único fin es que a ellos nos les falte nada, este es un buen ejemplo de superación ya que a pesar de los problemas a salido adelante.
 Doña Nimia está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de abarrotería como ser: jabones, churros, frescos, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, manteca, margarina, salsas, sal, pastas verduras y  galletas que son los productos que más se le venden, con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y por ende  mejorar un poco su calidad de vida.
Doña Nimia su sueño es tener un buen negocio y que se le gradúe su último hijo que esta dependiendo de ella.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2012
texts.en:
Nimia is a single 44 year old mother of one. Her son depends on her.  For the last 21 years she has been making a living selling fresh products, chicken, sausage, bagged water, churros, sweets, vegetables, cosmetics, grains, and bread.  Her business is located in San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.  

Nimia has worked very hard to give her child the opportunity to come out ahead.  Her main goal is that they have everything they need.  She is a great example of overcoming adversity because despite the problems she has encountered she has come out ahead.  

Nimia is seeking this loan to purchase soaps, churros, fresh produce, rice, sugar, beans, butter, margarine, sauces, salt, pastas, vegetables, and cookies because they are the best sellers.  With the help of this loan, Nimia plans to bring in better revenue and thus improving her quality of life.  Her dream is to a strong business and that her son graduates from university.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras - December 2012

loans.use: to purchase soaps, churros, fresh produce, rice, sugar, beans, butter, margarine, sauces, salt, pastas, vegetables, and cookies for her business.

loans.name: Los Almendros Del Coyolar Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ellas es Luisa quien tiene 30 años es una panadería es una mujer con cuatro hijos quienes le ayudan en el negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de pan como es la harina, levaduras, leña etc. Juana vende gaseosas y enchiladas ambulantes y en  su domicilio y José Alejandro tiene una pequeña pulpería en su domicilio
texts.en:
This group has three members, all entrepreneurs. One of the members, Luisa, is 30 years old and runs a bakery. She has four children who help out with the business. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of raw materials for making bread, such as flour, raising agents, firewood, etc. Juana sells soft drinks and enchiladas on the street and from her home, and José Alejandro has a small grocery store located in his house.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as flour, raising agents, firewood, etc.

loans.name: 30 De Mayo Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Reyna que hace 20 años vende elotes ambulantes y en su domicilio, en su comunidad es bien reconocida por su negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de elotes para acopio, Elizabeth y Juana son las dos integrantes del grupo se dedican ambas a la venta de elotes.
texts.en:
This group consists of three entrepreneurial members. One of these is Reyna, who for 20 years has sold corn as a street seller and in her home. In her community she is well-known for her business. 

She will invest this loan in the purchase of corn on the cob to store. Elizabeth and Juana are the two members of the group. They both make their living by selling corn on the cob.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of corn on the cob in large quantities.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
La señora María  de 36 años de edad, es soltera,  tiene dos  hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo,  al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 04  años  a la venta de frescos, granos básicos, verduras, churros, y mucho mas sus clientes le prefieren por su buen surtido en su pulpería su venta es de lunes a domingo, la mayoría de sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos de su comunidad.
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de frescos, pollo, aceites, papas, yuca, cebolla, chiles verdes, pataste, repollo, arroz, frijoles, café y azúcar que son los productos que más  vende, con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende mejorar un poco su nivel de vida y su negocio.
Doña María su sueño es mejorar su casa y su pulpería.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2012
texts.en:
María, 36, is single and has two children in her care.  She lives in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras and has her own home.  For four years she has been in the food business, selling fresh produce, basic grains, vegetables, and pastries, and many customers prefer her business because of the wide variety she offers.  She works Monday through Sunday and most of her customers are friends and neighbors in the community.

María is requesting a loan to buy fresh produce, chicken, oils, potatoes, yucca plant, onions, green peppers, broccoli, cabbage, rice, beans, coffee and sugar, which are the products she sells the most.  With the help of the loan she hopes to improve her lifestyle and business.  Her goal is to renovate her house and food business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - December 2012

loans.use: To buy good for her food business.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedores una de ellas es Martha que vende repostería ambulante. Tiene 4 años de tener su negocio es una mujer casada y con dos hijos. El crédito lo  invertirá en la compra de repostería como pico de pollo, trenzas, manjar, burro de queso, pan quesillo etc. Ana vende cosa de horno y Marbely vende ropa íntima de mujer.
texts.en:
It is a group formed by three enterprising partners, one of whom is Martha, who sells pastries on the street.  She has had this business for 4 years.  She is married and has two children.  

She will invest the loan money in the purchase of pastries such as chicken turnovers, bread braids, manjar (milk caramel), cheese pastries, cheese bread, etc.

Ana sells Nicaraguan corn cake, and Marbely sells women's lingerie.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of pastries such as chicken turnovers, bread braids, manjar (milk caramel), cheese pastries, cheese bread, etc.

loans.name: El Futuro Group

texts.es: Socias formadas por cuatro miembros todas originarias de Masaya, una de ellas es Marta Elena tiene tres años de comercializar cosméticos de la Avon, a sus vecinos cercanos a su comunidad, el crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos de la Avon como perfumen de dama y caballeros, lociones, cremas para manos, crema para cuerpos, crema para el pelo, gel para el pelo etc. Celia es otra miembro su negocio es el destace de cerdo y venta de comida, Martha vende tortilla y fritanga en su domicilio y Ruth vende pan y sopa los fines de semanas en su domicilio.
texts.en:
There are four members, and they are all from Masaya.  Marta Elena is one of them.  She has been selling Avon cosmetics to neighbors close to her community for three years.

She will use the loan to buy Avon cosmetics like perfume for men and women, lotion, hand cream, body cream, hair cream, and hair gel, etc. 

Celia is another member.  Her business is butchering pigs and selling food.  Martha sells tortillas and fried snacks at her house.  Ruth sells bread and soup at her house on the week-ends.

loans.use: to buy Avon cosmetics like perfume for men and women, lotion, hand cream, body cream, hair cream, and hair gel, etc.

loans.name: Las Flores De Buenos Aires Group

texts.es: Cordiales Saludos. Victoria es integrante del grupo “Las Flores De Buenos Aires” la cual está integrado por 08 socios luchadores que por medio de sus trabajos han logrado sacar adelante a sus familias. Este el caso de Victoria de 54  años casada con 07 hijos mayores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, aparte brinda hospedaje en su vivienda, de donde obtiene un ingreso extra para su hogar. Unos de sus logros es ver a sus hijos profesionales. Desea aperturar un puesto donde pueda ofrecer bebidas. Solicito el crédito para la compra de productos de belleza como colonias, talcos y cremas. El grupo “Las Flores De Buenos Aires” agradecen el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien con el Programa-Prosperidad. Victoria es la tercera del lado izquierdo, viste buza blanca y pantalón azul.
texts.en:
Warm greetings. Victoria is a member of the group the "Flowers of Buenos Aires" [Las Flores de Buenos Aires], which is made up of 8 hard-working members who, through their work, have fought to move their families ahead. This is the case with Victoria, who is 54 years old and has 7 older children. She makes a living selling beauty products. Apart from this, she provides guest accommodation in her house, which is how she earns extra income for her household. One of her achievements has been seeing her children become professionals. She wishes to open a stall where she can sell drinks. 

Victoria is asking for this credit in order to buy beauty products, such as colognes, powders, and creams. The "Flowers of Buenos Aires" group is grateful for the loan provided and they promise to continue working well with the Prosperity Program. 

Victoria is third from the left in the photo above, wearing a white short and blue pants.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products like colognes, powders, and creams

loans.name: Los Andenes Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Los Andenes” en la ciudad de Yucay. La ciudad de Yucay está a 48 kilómetros de Cusco, es uno de los lugares más acogedores del Valle Sagrado de los Incas, por su clima, gratos paisajes e impresionantes andenerías.  Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de comestibles, venta de carne, la venta de verduras, crianza de animales menores, venta de jora y otras.  

Gabina nació en el distrito de Yucay de la provincia del Urubamba  y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació, ella tiene 59 años y es casada. Su actividad económica de Gabina es la elaboración de artesanía, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como pinturas, arcilla y otras cosas más.
 Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (Los socios que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía llegaron después de la reunión).
texts.en:
The Los Andenes communal bank is a comprised of a group of friends and neighbors in the city of Yucay.  The city of Yucay is 48 kilometers from Cusco.  It is one of the most welcoming places in the Sacred Valley of the Incas because of its climate, pleasant scenery, and impressive terraced agriculture.

This communal bank is comprised of people who are constantly looking for opportunities to get ahead.  Through their daily effort they are looking to give their children a better future.

Examples of the members’ business activities are selling food, selling meat, selling vegetables, raising small animals, and selling corn, and others. 

Gabina was born in the Yucay district in the Urubamba province, and she lives in the same district in which she was born.  She is 59 years old and married.  Gabina’s business activity is making crafts.  

She now needs the loan to buy work materials like paints, clay, and others.

The members are grateful for the opportunity that has been provided, and they pledge to make their payments as scheduled.  

(The members who appear in the lower part of the photo arrived after the meeting.)

loans.use: to buy work materials like paints, clay, and others.

loans.name: Lesly Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socios una de ella es Lesly su negocio es vender calzado variado para todos los gustos, edades desde hace 2 años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de calzados para todas las edades, estilo y variados, Vilma vende cosméticos de la Avon y Miguel brinda servicios de moto taxis a la comunidad.
texts.en:
This is a group made up of three members. One of them is Lesly. For two years she has been selling a variety of footwear for all tastes and ages. 

She will use the loan to buy footwear for all ages, in all styles and varieties. Vilma sells Avon cosmetics and Miguel provides mototaxi services in the community

loans.use: To buy shoes for all ages, in all styles and of all kinds.

loans.name: Paula Isabel

texts.es: Microempresaria de éxito originaria de Masaya es Paula su negocio consiste en vender cosméticos variados de la Avon desde hace 3 años, los productos los vende a trabajadores de empresas cercana a su comunidad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos  como perfumen de varón y dama, lociones, crema para la cara,  crema para el cuerpo, crema para las manos, shampo de niño etc.
texts.en:
Paula is a successful small business owner from the city of Masaya.  For the past three years she has had a business selling Avon products.  She sells her merchandise to workers in her community.

She will use the loan proceeds to purchase cosmetics such as perfumes and colognes, lotions, creams for face, hands and body, children's shampoo, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics such as perfumes and colognes, lotions, creams, children's shampoo, and other items.

loans.name: Ositos Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ella es Angela es una cliente que tiene una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace cinco años, es madre soltera y con un hijo que le ayuda en el negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, papel higiénicos, sal, carne de res, carne de pollo, productos lácteos, etc. José Alonso vende fresquito, gelatina y bolis, Mayra tiene una pulpería en su domicilio
texts.en:
This is a group made up of three enterprising members. One of them is Angela. She is a client who has had a small general store in her home for five years. She is a single mother and has a son who helps her in the store. 

She will use the loan to purchase staples such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, toilet paper, salt, beef, chicken, and dairy products. 

José Alonso sells homemade fruit drinks, frozen fruit treats, and gelatin desserts. Mayra has a small general store in her home.

loans.use: To buy staples such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, toilet paper, salt, beef, chicken, and dairy products.

loans.name: Lucrecia Evangelina

texts.es: Doña Lucrecia es una microempresaria de éxito, tiene 49 años es casada y su negocio es un taller de costura y de bordado, actividad que viene realizando hace 7 años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como manta individual, elásticos, forro de sedas, crochet, hilo.
texts.en: Lucrecia is a successful small business person. She is 49, married, and her business is a sewing and embroidery workshop, a business that she has been doing for seven years. She will use the loan to buy raw materials such as individual lengths of cloth, elastics, silk lining, crochet supplies and thread.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as individual lengths of cotton cloth, elastics, silk lining, thread, etc.

loans.name: Wayna Taucaray Iii Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Wayna Taucaray III” en la ciudad del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de tejidos, sogas, papel de escritorio, ropa, comestibles, frutas, verduras, cosméticos y otros brindan servicios de transportes y seguridad. 

Juana  nació en la provincia del Cusco y tiene 43 años, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cinco hijos, ella tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en la venta papa, yuca, moraya y otras cosas más, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de papas, yucas y moraya. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the “Wayna Taucaray III” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  This communal bank is formed of people who seek ways at every moment to get ahead by means of their daily efforts to provide a better future for their children.  Some examples of the members’ economic activities are: textile sales, ropes, office supplies, clothes, food, fruit, vegetables, cosmetics; some provide transportation and security services.

Juana was born in Cusco Province.  She’s 43-years-old, married and her beautiful relationship has yielded five children.  She has a small business consisting of the sale of potato, manioc and dehydrated potatoes, among other things.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy merchandise like sacks of potatoes, manioc and dehydrated potatoes.  

The members in general are grateful for the opportunity provided and commit to make their various installment payments as scheduled.

Cusco is located in Cusco District, Province and Department in the very heart of the ancient Inca city and it’s noted for being a tourism center thanks to its archaeological sites, historic city center, scenery and history and for being an enchanting city in the southern region of the country.  Cusco is known for being a very commercial, tourist center, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located there.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sacks of potatoes, manioc and dehydrated potatoes.

loans.name: Rahaf Group

texts.en:
Rahaf is a four-member group from Aden, Yemen. All the members are women. They have requested a 190,000 YER loan to buy cosmetics and clothes.

Dhanein 34, is the mother of four children. Two of them are in enrolled in public schools. She only knows how to read and write. Two years ago, Dhanein decided to help her husband. He works very hard and does his best to provide his family with food and clothes, but, unfortunately, the money he makes is really not enough. In the beginning, she started going to door to door, selling others products. After she had enough experience in selling cosmetics and clothes, she intends to have her own business selling clothes, perfumes and incense; therefore, she asked for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy clothes, perfumes and incense to resell. She hopes that she makes profits from buying a lot of products and selling them to new clients in different quarters and places in her city.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes and incense for resale.

loans.name: Om-Nawas Group

texts.en:
Om-Nawas group consists of three women from Aden, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 130,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture.

Aniate is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband is very hardworking and doing his best to earn money. She intends to renovate her house. She decided to help her husband and applied for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy construction supplies to use for her house. She hopes that their life conditions will improve and that they will find capital to buy and sell products.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Dambae district in Cambodia’s Kampong Cham province, Mao is 28 years of age and married. To offer a decent life to her family, Mao has been farming rice, planting cassava and also selling grocery items. They have been in this business for eight years.
 
Mao has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and completely paid back the previous loan, which helped her better support her family’s business. Now she is applying for another loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Cristo Moreno Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Cristo Moreno” en la ciudad del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de artículos de limpieza, venta de materiales de metal, venta de comestibles, venta de chompas, venta de cosméticos, elaboración de escobas y otros brindar servicios de diversión. 

Luz Marina nació en la provincia del Cusco y tiene 40 años, es soltera pero aun no tiene hijos, ella tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en la venta de carne  de cordero, chancho, res  y pollo, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como carne de cordero y pollo. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbors formed the “Cristo Moreno” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  This communal bank is formed of people who seek ways at every moment to get ahead by means of their daily efforts to provide a better future for their children.  Some examples of the members’ economic activities are: cleaning supplies sales, metal sales, food sales, sweater sales, cosmetics sales, broom making; some provide entertainment services.

Luz Marina was born in Cusco Province.  She’s 40-years-old, single and has no children yet.  She has a small business consisting in the sale of lamb, pork, beef and chicken.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy lamb and chicken.  

The members in general are grateful for the opportunity provided and commit to make their various installment payments as scheduled.

Cusco is located in Cusco District, Province and Department in the very heart of the ancient Inca city and it’s noted for being a tourism center thanks to its archaeological sites, historic city center, scenery and history and for being an enchanting city in the southern region of the country.  Cusco is known for being a very commercial, tourist center, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located there.

loans.use: to buy lamb and chicken.

loans.name: Al-Naseem Group

texts.en:
The Al-Naseem group consists of five woman from Taiz, Yemen.  They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.

Naseem is the leader of the group. She is 27-year-old married woman. She did not complete her education because she got married when she was very young. She studied until elementary school. She has children: the eldest one is 12 years old and the youngest is one.

All the family live in a small house. It is very difficult and uncomfortable for them. She accumulated a small amount of money and has started building but, unfortunately, now she doesn't have the money to buy the windows for the room. Therefore, she asked for a 30,000 YER loan to buy windows for the room.

In the future, she looks forward to building a new room and completing her house so that she can provide better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to buy windows for a room

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Sokun is age 26 years and married. She has two children to take care of and they are too young for school. To feed her family, Sokun has worked hard for six years as a farmer who grows rice, cashew nuts and cassava. The current business earns them about 25,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 8,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Sokun’s group consists of two members who are both female. She has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles, while the other member has just been with VisionFund for this loan cycle. Sokun fully repaid the other loans, which have helped her gradually improve her living with enough foods. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farmland. She hopes to make healthy crops to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farmland

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Mom is 27 and married with three children. For the last four years, she and her husband have been farming rice and operating a battery charging service in the local area as the primary business for her family. The current business earns her about 39,000 KHR per day after daily expenses.

Mom is in her first cycle as a client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for labor costs to harvest rice. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs to harvest rice.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Naphy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham Province’s Damabe District, Naphy is 37 years old and married. She has five children who are still in school. Naphy’s income is mainly from cassava planting and her husband also supplements the income by working for others for a fee. Together, she and her husband are able to make 20,000 KHR per day to cover the family's daily necessary expenses. 

Naphy is in her first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Naphy will use her portion to lease a plot of farmland to grow cassava. She hopes to grow more cassava so as to sell them for a good price and so better her living conditions.

loans.use: To lease a plot of farmland to grow cassava.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal is 33 years old and a villager living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Cambodia. She is married and a mother of four dependent children, all of whom are school-aged children. Phal offers a decent life for her family by growing cassava while her husband complements the income by working for others for a wage. Together, they are able to earn around 25,000KHR per day and manage to save approximately 10,000KHR after offsetting the daily cost of living.
This will be Phal’s second time requesting a loan via Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The previous loan has enabled her to better support her family and improve the family’s living condition as well. Now, Phal is leading a loan group of four female members to request a loan. As a group representative, Phal will spend her loan portion to buy rice to support of her family. She hopes this loan will enable her family to better their living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice to support her family.

loans.name: Hing's Group

texts.en:
Hing, 31, is married and lives with her husband and one son in a village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband have been involved in growing rice, cassava and raising pigs for 11 years, earning about 28,000 KHR per day to feed her family. She manages to save about 12,000 KHR after daily expenses. 

Hing has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle and fully repaid back the past loan, which has helped to better support her family as well as her current business. Now she is forming a group of three to ask for another loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. Hing, who is the leader, will use her portion to pay rent on her farmland so she can grow more cassava. She hopes to gain more income for her family to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay rent on her farmland so she can grow more cassava.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Ms. Rubina is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community with her husband for the last three years. The man shown in the photo is Rubina’s husband. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and enjoys a good client list. She is the mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy supplies of rice and flour from the market at lower prices. She then would be able to meet increasing demand consistently. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has an excellent repayment record. She wishes to use part of her revenues to cover personal expenses and part to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy supplies of rice and flour for her store from the market at lower prices.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok resides in a rural village of Dambae district in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He is 50 years old and married. Sok has five children, three of whom are school-aged children and still dependent on him. To earn a living for the family, Sok and his wife have been growing rice and cassava for 30 years. In order to increase his family's income, Sok also catches fish. The current businesses that Sok operates have enabled him to earn around 55,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This will be Sok's third time requesting a loan via Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The loans that he obtained and successfully paid back helped him improve the living conditions of his family. This time, he is leading his group of two to apply for a loan with VisionFund. Sok, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his plantation. He hopes to increase his crop yield so he can sell more for a good price to better off his living conditions and keep his children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his plantation.

loans.name: Qalib

texts.en:
Qalib is a 29-year-old man and is married with three children.  He sells food products such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop.  Qalib has 4 years of experience in this field and is considered as a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 120 AZN. His wife helps him to sell products in the shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of a good location in the central bazaar.

Qalib would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose, he applied for 1,500 AZN. He will purchase additional foodstuffs and diversify.

loans.use: to buy more diverse additional food products

loans.name: Kaniz

texts.en: Ms. Kaniz is 24 year old married woman. She is a housewife and lives with her three children, her husband and her father-in-law. The man shown in the photo is Kaniz’s husband, who has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses. It now requires maintenance to keep it running reliably. Kaniz has applied to Kashf Foundation for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy new tires for her husband’s vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Kaniz is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring him more profits. She dreams of providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband’s rickshaw.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea is a villager from a rural area located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district of Cambodia. She is 31 years old and married with four children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice, planting cassava and rubber tree. Having been in this business for 11 years, together, they can earn about 38,000KHR per day and manage to save about 20,000KHR each day after daily expenses.
Kunthea has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles while the other members have been with VisionFund from one to two cycles. Kunthea completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group of three to request another loan. As the leader, she is going use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to get a high yield from her plantation business to make a better living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy is a 33-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She lives in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of the Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she is a rice farmer.  Her husband works as a construction worker to earn additional income for the family. Having been in this business for 8 years, she is able to earn about 39,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 21,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses.

Channy just started with VisionFund this loan cycle. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to buy construction materials for her husband’s business and use a portion of it to pay for labor costs in harvesting rice. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income to improve her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her husband’s business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sariya

texts.en:
Ms Sariya, 49 years old, is a vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand embroidery for the past five years. She is passionate about her work and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Sariya’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She is a mother of five children. She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would teach embroidery skills so they can help her expand her business and earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities

loans.name: Gaza Group

texts.en:
Gaza is a group that consists of four woman from Taiz, Yemen. They are requesting a 160,000 YER loan from AMB to help them improve their businesses.

Huda, 24, is the mother of three children. She didn’t complete her education because she got married when she was 18 years old. Her eldest child is 4 years old and the youngest is just a month old. 

Shehas started her business two years ago. She goes door-to-door selling products in her neighborhood. She is making modest profits. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER to expand her business. She wants to buy a new collection of products and sell them to clients not only in her neighborhood but also in nearby quarters. She looks forward to opening her own retail store when she has earned enough profit.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of products for her business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms. Razia is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last four years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in the private sector and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She wants to educate her children so she is running her store to cover their educational expenses. She is a mother of four and is motivated to provide for her family. 

Because she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Ms. Samina is a 22 year old married woman and mother of one child. She has been engaged in the business of making gloves for the past four years. She has become famous in her community and has attained a regular list of customers. Her husband works in a power loom factory but his income is not sufficient to meet the family's daily expenditures. Therefore, Ms. Samina is working hard to contribute to the family's income.  

At this time, she is very satisfied and is requesting a loan of 15000 PKR to buy another sewing machine, thread, and needles. She expects to boost her earnings. She will spend the profits enhancing the lives of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Ms Fatima is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of four children.  She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last five years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is motivated to provide for her family. 

Because she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her second loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Ms. Kausar is a 47-year-old married woman and is a mother of five. She has been in the business of cloth trade for many years. She is famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Most of her clients are her neighbors. 

Kausar is making enough to lead a decent life, while her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to bear the daily expenditures of his family members. Kausar is highly contributing to the family income to support her family through all her hard work. Her customer base is diverse and varied. She is much in demand and highly appreciated among her customers. 

However, due to low cash in hand, Kausar is facing difficulties in fulfilling the demands of her customers. For this, she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy a wide variety of cloth in various colors and designs to add to her new ones. 

She expects a boost in her earnings and desires to spend part of it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in various colors and designs to add to her new ones.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Taiz is a lively and big city. There are a lot of workers who eat their breakfast and lunch at coffee shops. This business allows coffee shops to make a good profit. 

Hassan is a 50 year old married man and father of four children. He owns a coffee shop. The shop is making a modest profit, so Hassan would like to improve it by adding new food items to the menu. Hassan is requesting a 80,000 YER loan from AMB to buy an electric deep fryer. With additional food items on the menu, the shop will new customers such as students. He looks forward to earning large profits from the coffee shop, which will allow him to improve his family's living conditions and open a savings account at AMB.

loans.use: to buy an electric deep fryer for his business.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Ms. Nasreen has been in the business of stitching for many years. She is a very talented woman and is eager to contribute to the family income. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community, so she decided to initiate her own business with support of Kashf Foundation. She is living with her parents and has four siblings, of which she is the eldest. Her father is a government servant and his income is not enough to cover family expenditures. 

Nasreen has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She is in her sixth loan cycle, and every time she repays her loan on time. Currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase more spools of thread and packs of buttons, laces, and zippers in different colors in order to meet increasing demand. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her siblings through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread as well as packs of buttons, lace, and zippers in different colors to meet increasing demand.

loans.name: Suraya

texts.en: Ms. Suraya is an active 44-year-old, a married woman. She is has been efficiently running a beauty parlor in her home for the last six years. She has received a lot of appreciation from the members of her community. She makes enough to lead a decent life, though her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the everyday expenditures of their household. She is the loving mother of six children. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health care and education. She has slowly but surely improved her beauty parlor by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a stock of cosmetics,  hair treatment products and cleansers. She expects to earn more profits and thus to  be able to give better support to her family. She intends to spend the part of the income on providing good quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, hair treatment products and cleansers for her home-based beauty parlor.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Ms. Tasleem is a 47 year old married woman and mother of two children. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Ms. Tasleem’s husband. Her store offers various goods at reasonable prices and has a good number of clients. 

Ms. Tasleem makes enough money to contribute to her family's income. She is motivated to provide for her family and is eager to provide her children with a quality education. Since she wants to expand her business, she is requesting a loan of 20000 PKR to buy rice, grains, and flour from the market in bulk at lower prices. This would allow her to consistently meet the increasing demand for these products.

Ms. Tasleem is in her second loan cycle and has an excellent repayment record. She will use part of her revenues to pay for personal expenses and increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, grain, and flour from the market in bulk at lower prices.

loans.name: Muryum

texts.en:
Ms Muryum is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of hand-embroidery for many years. Muryum is a mother of five children. One of her sons is shown in the photo. He assists her in completing orders on time. She receives many orders for special occasions like weddings, parties etc. By this time, she has become famous in her community for providing elegant dresses of unique embroidery patterns to her customers. 

In order to fulfill the demands of her customers on time, she needs to purchase more spools of threads, pearls and sequins in various colors. For this, she applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 from Kashf foundation.  She is in her sixth loan cycle with an excellent repayment history. She expects a boost in her net income and wishes to spend part of it on the betterment of her family members. She also aspires to save money to buy her own house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, pearls and sequins in various colors.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en: Ms Ishrat is a 48-year-old married woman. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Ten years ago, she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. Therefore, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 15,000. She intends to use this loan to buy raw materials including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zippers etc. to create a means of increasing revenues to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zippers etc

loans.name: Jakelin Alexandra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MAQUIMANTA PURISUN, este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Jakelin tiene 31 años de edad, 02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de autopartes para carros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son parabrisas, siliconas, llantas entre otros,  siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de parabrisas para su negocio.
La socia sale en la foto con uno de sus hijos. 
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Jakelin, 31, belongs to the “Maquimanta Purisun” communal bank located in Cusco District, Cusco Province and Department.  She has a spouse and two children.  She alternates her daily activities with a business selling auto spare parts.  She’s been in business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it daily.  She sells windshields, silicone and tires, among others.  This is how she supports her family.  

She’s requesting a loan to buy windshields for her business.  She appears in the photo with one of her children.  She feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy windshields.

loans.name: Lucho

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal MAQUIMANTA PURISUN, este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Lucho  tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y  tiene 02 hijos, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de autopartes para carros, el socio vende lo que son parabrisas, siliconas, llantas entre otros,  el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de retrovisores para su negocio.
El socio se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
He is a member of the “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN” communal bank, locate in the Cusco, province, and department.

He is 38 years old, lives with his wife and two children, and sells auto parts such as windshields, silicon parts, tires, and other things.  He has been doing this for some time and things are going well for him thanks to his daily efforts.  He wants to be able to continue to work so that he can continue to support his family this way.  

He is asking for this loan to buy rear view mirrors for his business.

loans.use: to buy invnetory.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MAQUIMANTA PURISUN, este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Leonarda tiene 55 años de edad, tiene  01 hijo y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de salchipapas,y venta de chicha de quinua, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez vende comida los días de feria en una de las plazas de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz, papas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Leonarda belongs to the communal bank Maquimanta Purisun which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.  She is 55 years old, single, and has one child.  She balances her daily activities with her business selling salchipapas (Peruvian dish consisting of pan-fried sausage and potatoes served with various sauces) and quinoa chicha (sweet drink made from quinoa).  Leonarda's business is successful because of the effort she puts in each day.  She also sells food during festivals in one of the plazas in the city of Cusco.  

Leonarda is a responsible person that helps her family move forward.  She is asking for this loan to buy supplies such as oil, rice, and potatoes.  She is thankful for the loan and promises to fulfull the established payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as oil, rice, potatoes, and other things.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brígida continúa en el banco comunal “Virgen Purificada de Angostura”, con la venta de verduras y con la crianza de animales menores. Ya son varios años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas.

Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Brígida continues in the “Virgen Purificada de Angostura” communal bank selling vegetables and raising small farm animals.  She’s been in these businesses for years now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy small farm animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  She’s happy about the loan and committed to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy small farm animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Nayruth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MAQUIMANTA PURISUN, este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Nayruth tiene 41 años de edad, 02 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de autopartes para carros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son parabrisas, siliconas, llantas entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de siliconas, retrovisores entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
Nayruth, 41 belongs to the communal bank MAQUIMANTA PURISUN, which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.  She is single and has two children, and alternates her daily activities with her automobile spare parts business.  Thanks to her hard work, she has been in business for several years selling windshield wipers, rubber parts, tires and other items.  She is responsible and dedicated to the work she does to provide for her family.

Nayruth is requesting a loan to buy rubber parts, rearview mirrors and other parts.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy rubber parts, rearview mirrors and other items.

loans.name: Isabel Flora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MAQUIMANTA PURISUN, este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Isabel Flora tiene 34 años de edad, 01 hijo y es viuda, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de autopartes para carros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son parabrisas, siliconas, llantas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de parabrisas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Isabel Flora belongs to the communal bank Maquimanta Purisun which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.  She is 34 years old, widowed, and has one child.  She balances her daily activities with her business selling spare parts for cars.  Isabel has spent many years in her business which is successful because of the effort she puts in every day.  She sells windshields, car wax, tires, and other things.  She hopes to continue to work in order to help her family.  

Isabel is asking for this loan to buy windshields for her business.  She is thankful for the loan and promises to fulfuill her established payments.

loans.use: to buy windshields for her business.

loans.name: Yovana Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MAQUIMANTA PURISUN, este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Yovana tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de autopartes para carros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son parabrisas, siliconas, llantas entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando  para de esta forma agradar mas su negocio.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de siliconas, retrovisores entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
She is a member of the “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN” communal bank, located in the Cusco district, province, and department.

Yovana is 24 years old, in a common law marriage, and sells auto parts.  She’s been doing this for some time and things have gone well for her because of her dedication.  She sells windshields, silicon parts, tires, and other things.  She is responsible and hardworking and wants to keep working and growing her business.

She is asking for this loan to buy silicon parts, mirrors, and other things.  She is grateful and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy auto parts.

loans.name: Genoveva Betty

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MAQUIMANTA PURISUN, este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Genoveva tiene 37 años de edad, 02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de autopartes para carros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son parabrisas, siliconas, llantas entre otros,  siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
Genoveva belongs to the “Maquimanta Purisun” communal bank located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Genoveva is 37 years old, has 2 children and is in a common law marriage. Her daily activities focus on her automobile parts business. She has had this business for years, and it is going well, thanks to the effort she devotes to the business each day. She sells windshields, silicons, and tires, among other items. This is how Genoveva advances her family. 

She is soliciting a loan to purchase tires to re-stock her store.

Genoveva is grateful for the loan offer and she promises to comply with her schedule of payments.

loans.use: to buy tires to restock her business.

loans.name: Emma Gloria

texts.es:
Emma  continúa en el banco comunal “Virgen Purificada de Angostura”, con la agricultura y con la venta de productos de primera necesidad. Ya son varios años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, leche, fideos, huevos, pan, carne, verduras  y otras cosas más. 
Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Emma continues in the “Virgen Purificada de Angostura” communal bank working in agriculture and selling basic staple goods.  She’s been in these businesses for years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy merchandise like sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, milk, noodles, eggs, bread, meat, vegetables and other things.  She’s happy about the loan and committed to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Hector Gonzalo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal MAQUIMANTA PURISUN, este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Héctor tiene 26 años de edad y es conviviente, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de autopartes para carros, el socio vende lo que son parabrisas, siliconas, llantas entre otros,  el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma agrandar su negocio.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas para su negocio.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
He is a member of the “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN” communal bank, locate in the Cusco, province, and department.

Hector is 26 years old, lives with his wife, and sells auto parts such as windshields, silicon parts, tires, and other things. He has been doing this for some time and things are going well for him thanks to his daily efforts. He wants to be able to continue to work so that he can continue to support his family this way. 
He is asking for this loan to buy tires for his business.

He is grateful for this loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Purificada de Angostura”, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras en uno de los mercados populares de la encantadora ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras como cebollas, culandro, perejil, zanahorias, tomates, coliflor, lechuga, harberjas,  habas  y entres otros. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Celia is a member of the "Virgen Purificada de Angostura" communal bank and makes a living selling vegetables in one of the popular markets of the enchanting city of Cusco.  She has had this business for some years now and it is going well, thanks to her determination.  Celia needs this loan to buy vegetables such as onions, coriander, parsley, carrots, tomatoes, cauliflower, lettuce, broad beans and more.  She is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly continúa en el banco comunal “Virgen Purificada de Angostura” y con la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos y cuyes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales como cuyes y gallinas de doble pechuga. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Nelly is still a member of the "Virgen Purificada de Angostura" communcal bank and continues to raise and sell young animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs.  She has had the business for some years and it is going well, thanks to her determination.  On this occasion Nelly needs a loan to buy animals, such as guinea pigs and double breasted hens. She is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy animals such as guinea pigs and double breasted hens.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: Filomena pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Purificada de Angostura” y su actividad económica es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, pan, aceite entre otras cosas.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de azúcar y sacos de arroz. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Filomena is a member of the “Virgen Purificada de Angostura” and sells primary needs products such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, bread, cooking oil, and other things.  She has been doing this for several years and things have gone well because of her dedication.  She needs this loan to buy merchandise such as sugar and sacks of rice.  She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es: Benigna continúa con el  banco comunal “Virgen Purificada de Angostura” y con su actividad económica que consiste en la venta de animales menores como cuyes, pollos y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar gallinas y cuyes.  Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Benigna is still with the communal bank "Virgen Purificada de Angostura" and continues to sell small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and hens.  She has been in business for several years now; and it is going well because of the hard work she puts into it.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy hens and guinea pigs.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy hens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es: Evelin continúa con el  banco comunal “Virgen Purificada de Angostura” y con sus actividades de elaboración de cereales, crianza de animales menores, elaboración y venta de ladrillos y tejas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar gallinas y cuyes.  Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Evelin is still with the "Virgen Purifcada de Angostura" communal bank and continues to produce cereals, raise young animals and produce and sell bricks and rooftiles.  She has now had these businesses for some years and they are going well, thanks to her determination.  On this occasion, Evelin needs a loan to buy hens and guinea pigs.  She is happy with the loan and committed to making the repayments.

loans.use: to buy hens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Abelinda Ayme

texts.es: Abelinda continúa con el  banco comunal “Virgen Purificada de Angostura” y con la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar gallinas y cuyes y alimento como pasto y afrecho.  Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Abelinda is still with the communal bank "Virgen Purificada de Angostura! and continues to raise small animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She has been in the business several years now; and it is going very well thanks to the hard work she puts into it.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy hens and guinea pigs, as well as animal feed such as fodder and bran.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy hens, guinea pigs, fodder and bran.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia continúa con el  banco comunal “Virgen Purificada de Angostura” y con la venta de comida y con la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar fideos, leche, aceite, pan, verduras y otras cosas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para insumos como carne de gallina, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Antonia continues with the communal bank "Virgen Purificada de Angostura" and with her business of selling food and staple goods such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, oil, bread, vegetables and other items.  She has been in business for several years now; and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as hen meat, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar and other goods.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as hen meat, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar and other items.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es: Yessica continúa con el  banco comunal “Virgen Purificada de Angostura” y con la venta de comida (Desayuno, almuerzo y cenas). Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para implementar el restaurante entonces va comprar sillas y mesas. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Yessica is still with with the "Virgen Purificada de Angostura" communal bank and continues to sell meals (breakfast, lunch and dinner).  She has been doing this for some years and, thanks to her determination, the business is going well.  On this occasion, Yessica needs the loan to buy chairs and tables for her restaurant.  She is happy to have the loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her restaurant.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita continúa con el  banco comunal “Virgen Purificada de Angostura” y  con la venta de golosinas como chupetes, caramelos, galletas y chicles en una carreta de forma ambulatoria, ella también se está dedicando a la venta de pollipapas y salchipapas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como carne de pollo y papas. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Margarita continues with the "Virgen Purificada de Angostura” communal bank and is still selling candy, such as lollipops, biscuits and chewing gum from a moving cart.  She also makes a living selling fried potatoes with either hot dog or chicken.  She has had this business for some years now and, thanks to her determination, it is going very well.  She needs this loan to buy supplies such as chicken meat and potatoes.  She is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as chicken meat and potatoes.

loans.name: Ruth Delia

texts.es: Ruth Delia continúa en el  banco comunal “Virgen Purificada de Angostura” y con la venta de granos secos como  cebada, maíz y trigo y también con la venta de verduras como lechugas, tomates, cebollas, perejil y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar granos secos y verduras. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Ruth Delia remains with the "Virgen Purificada de Angostura" communal bank and is selling dry grains such as barley, corn and wheat as well as vegetables such as lettuce, tomatoes, onions, parsley and others.  She has been doing this for some years and, thanks to her determination, the business is going well.  On this occasion, Ruth Delia needs the loan to buy dry grains and vegetables.  She is happy with the loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: to buy dry grains and vegetables.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila continúa en el  banco comunal “Virgen Purificada de Angostura” y con la venta de comida preparar desayuno, almuerzos y cenas pero también prepara platos típicos de la región como por ejemplo arroz con pollo, estofado de pollo, rocoto relleno, apanado, lomo saltado entres otros.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, azúcar, verduras, carne, papa y otras cosas más. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Zoila continues in the communal bank “Virgen Purificada de Angostura” (Virgin Purified of Angostura) and with the sale of food; cooking breakfast, lunch and dinner but also typical dishes of the region, such as rice with chicken, chicken stew, sfuffed hot perppers, breaded, “lomo saltado” (marinated steak with vegetables) among others.

It has been several years since she has been making a living from this business and she is doing well because of her efforts. This time, she needs a loan to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, vegetables, meat, potato, among others. She is happy with the loan and promises to pay punctually all the payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, vegetables, meat and potato for her food-selling business.

loans.name: Jackelinne Benita

texts.es: La Sra. Jackelinne  tiene 40 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de  4 y 12, Ella se dedica al venta de licores como también de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en su tienda  de Venta de Abarrotes el anterior crédito lo utilizo este fin de año en la compra de licores cidra y vino, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito y en esta ocasión utilizar el dinero para la compra de  mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, refrescos y galletas por mayor.
texts.en:
Jackelinne is 40 years old, married and has two children ages 12 and 4.  She works her own small grocery store from which she sells liquor, groceries and basic necessities.

Jackelinne used her previous loan at the end of this past year to buy liquor, cider and wine, which she says turned out very well for her.  This time she will use the loan to buy wholesale merchandise such as groceries, soft drinks and cookies with which to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise such as groceries, soft drinks and cookies with which to stock her store.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de comida,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria repartiendo la comida a obreros que trabajan en construccion,la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platos como arroz,con pollo, saltado,sopas entre otros,siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para al compra de insumos como arroz,aceite,menestras entre otros para su negocio.

La socia se compremete a cumplir con los pagos correspondientes de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The borrower continues with her food sales business.  She has been in the business for years, and it is going well for her thanks to the daily effort she puts into it.  She sells in an itinerant manner, delivering food to construction workers. She makes different dishes like arroz con pollo [chicken and rice], saltado [meat and potatoes], and soups, among others.  In this way she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies for her business like rice, cooking oil, and legumes, among others.  She pledges to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business like rice, cooking oil, and legumes, among others.

loans.name: Libia Lourdes

texts.es:
La Señora. Libia forma parte desde hace 3 años del banco comunal Mujeres de Chilcatotoras, es una mujer luchadora y le gusta la banca comunal por el gran compañerismo que existe en el grupo. Vive por el sector de Chilcatotoras que pertenece a la parroquia de Tarqui en Cuenca, esta parroquia es reconocida por sus verdes pastos y por sus paisajes inspiradores, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican a la ganadería, crianza de animales y agricultura.
