This group is called Nagla, which consists of 5 ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB.

Jwahr is 34 years old. She has been a tailor for many years. She invests in Sana'a and she is hardworking woman who is happy to work in her business. Almost all of her clients are neighbours. Jwahr would like to increase her profits, but cannot due to the lack of money to buy sewing products. So, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER. She wishes that with the loan she will increase her income to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy sewing products to use for sewing

loans.name: Mara

texts.es: Mara es madre de tres hijos, trabaja en agricultura y otros oficios, con esfuerzo propio ha logrado comenzar la construcción de una tapia de seguridad para su casa, pero necesita comprar más material como cemento, block, arena, piedra, malla de acero y otros materiales para poder concluirla, ella necesita un crédito de un millón treinta y cinco mil colones (¢1.035.000), manifiesta que para ella es muy importante realizar este trabajo para proteger tanto su vivienda como para brindarle seguridad a sus niños.
texts.en: Mara is the mother of three children. She works in agriculture and at other jobs. Through her own effort she has been able to start building a security wall around her house, however she needs to purchase more materials, such as cement, blocks, sand, rocks, steel mesh and other items, so that she can finish the construction. She needs a loan for one million, thirty five thousand colones ((¢1.035.000). She states that it is very important for her to complete this work in order to protect her dwelling and provide security for her children.

loans.use: to purchase materials to finish building a security wall around her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fifteen sheep and one milking cow.

loans.name: Justa Angela

texts.es:
Justa  vive en  el cantón de libertad  Tiene 60  años. Es soltera .no tiene  hijo. Ella Tomo  la decisión de buscar trabajo para salir adelante con su familia  y  como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. Ella decide juntar dinero  para dar apertura  a su negocio una tienda de viveres.

En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  una clientela  necesarias justa  trabaja en su negocio sola   diariamente, ella  Con el préstamo comprara  arroz azúcar aceite , varios, etc. su meta es ampliar su negocio y colocarlo en su vivienda
texts.en:
Justa lives in Libertad Canton.  She’s 60-years-old and has no children.  She decided to seek work to get ahead with her family but since no one would give her the opportunity to work for a firm decided to gather money together to open her own general store.

Her business has grown gradually and as of now has the required clientele.  Justa works in her business by herself every day.  She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.  Her goal is to expand the business and to set it up at home.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: José Lázaro

texts.es:
José tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos; de 6, 4 y dos años de edad. Él tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la panificación; inicio cuando emigro de su comunidad  a la ciudad y empezó a trabajar lavando los moldes en una panadería, poco a poco él fue aprendiendo como se elaboraba el pan. Debido a la violencia que se vive en la ciudad, José decidió emigrar nuevamente a la comunidad e instalar su propia panadería. 

La harina, mantecas, entre otros insumos para elaborar el pan, los compra en la capital del país, viaja una vez por semana 160 kilómetros de ida y regreso a su casa, gastando unos $20 dólares solo de transporte. Él compra 20 bolsas de harina en cada viaje, pero su compra no califica para que se lo envíen a domicilio.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar latas, harina para elaborar pan dulce, una bicicleta para emplear a otro vendedor. Él tiene tres empleados que salen a vender pan en bicicletas a las comunidades y con la nueva bicicleta contratara a otro empleado más haciendo un total de cuatro. Actualmente, solo elabora pan francés; pero con el crédito elaborara pan dulce, ya que sus clientes se lo están demandando. Su esposa le ayuda a elaborar el pan; pero esporádicamente porque se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old, married, and has three children who are 6, 4 and 2 years old. He has been working as a baker for 15 years and started when he moved from his hometown to the city and got a job washing the molds at a bakery. Little by little he learned how to make bread. Due to the violence of the city, José decided to move back to his hometown and start his own bakery. 

He buys flour, butter, and other baking supplies in the country's capital. He travels the 160 km to the city once a week and spends 20 dollars just on transport. He buys 20 bags of flour on every journey, but his purchase does not qualify for home delivery. 

He is requesting the loan from Fundación Campo to buy baking trays, flour to make sweet bread, and a bicycle so that he can hire another employee. José has three employees who go out on bicycles to sell bread in the surrounding communities, and with another bicycle he will be able to hire another employee making a total of four. Currently, he only makes French bread, but with the help of the loan, he will start to make sweet breads, which is what his customers are asking for. His wife helps him to make the bread, but only from time to time because she has to take care of their children.

loans.use: to buy baking trays, flour to make sweet bread, and a bicycle for another vendor he plans to hire.

loans.name: José Blas

texts.es:
José tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Cuando tenia 24 años de edad, decidió aprender el oficio de estructuras metálicas con un vecino; hoy en día ya tiene 12 años de experiencia en este oficio. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un vehiculo para trasladar sus herramientas y ya no pagar por ese servicio. Así, se ahorrara este pago y lo podrá utilizar para la educación de sus hijos y para mejorar la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old, married, and has two children.  When he was 24 years old, he decided to learn the metalworking trade with a neighbor.  Today he has 12 years of experience in this trade.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy a vehicle to transport his tools so he will no longer have to pay for this service.  This will save him this expense, which he will be able to put toward his children's education and improving his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to transport his tools

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es una mujer muy trabajadora y esforzada, tiene una panadería y sus productos han sido muy aceptados por su clientela, ella también entrega mercadería a domicilio, por lo cual necesita comprar una motocicleta para facilitar su trabajo, el crédito que está solicitando es por un millón treinta y cinco mil colones
(¢1.035.000), de esta manera manifiesta Paula podrá aumentar su clientela porque puede abarcar más lugares donde ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Paula is a very hard working and industrious woman. She has a bakery and her products have been widely accepted by her clientele, she also offers deliveries. For this reason, she needs to buy a motorcycle to facilitate her work. 

The loan that she is requesting is for a million thirty and five thousand colones ( ¢1,035,000 ). In this way, Paula, expresses, may increase her clientele because she could cover more places to offer her products.

loans.use: Compra de motocicleta

loans.name: Ziyaddin

texts.en:
Ziyaddin is a 34-year-old man. He is single and breeds cattle and sells them for meat purposes to local butchers right from his home. Ziyaddin has five years of experience in this field, thank to his brother who currently helps him and taught him the best ways to look after cattle.

Ziyaddin usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them in 5-6 months, and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar. Meat selling brings a monthly income of 200 AZN. People use beef in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always with yoghurt sauce. 

This is his only financial income. Ziyaddin applied for 1500 AZN to purchase three baby calves, one milk cow, and fodder.

loans.use: to buy three baby calves, one milk cow, and fodder

loans.name: Diris Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Diris 36  años de edad, vive en su casa de habitación con su hija que dependen de ella, su conyugue vive en los Estados Unidos.
Doña Diris vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo,  al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 04   años  a la venta de ropa nueva, sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos.
Doña Diris es una mujer trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir adelante, la venta de sus  productos las realiza de forma ambulante en los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo y se moviliza en taxi cuando sale largo de su casa, este es un ejemplo de trabajo y dedicación.
Doña Diris está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de camisas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, blusas, calcetines y también para cables para electrificación y pintura porque quiere realizar una  mejora en casa.
Doña Diris con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar su casa y su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero del 2013.
texts.en:
Diris, age 36, lives at her house with her daughter, who is dependent upon her.  Her husband lives in the United States.  Diris lives a community in San Lorenzo in southern Honduras, and she has her own house.  She has been selling new clothes for four years.  Her customers are her friends and neighbors.

Diris is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She sells her products in an itinerant manner in the neighborhoods and suburbs of San Lorenzo.  She goes by taxi when she goes far from her house.  This is an example of her work and dedication.

Diris is requesting the loan to buy shirts, skirts, pants, dresses, blouses, and socks.  She will also buy electrical wiring and paint because she wants to make an improvement to her house.  With the support of this loan Diris intends to improve her house and her business and, therefore, her quality of life.  She is very happy to continue working with Prisma.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – January 2013

loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts, pants, dresses, blouses, and socks for her business.

loans.name: Danis Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Danis  de 30  años de edad es casado, tiene dos hijos  que dependen de él, sus hijos tiene edades de 05 y 03 años, vive en una comunidad de Choluteca al sur de Honduras, vive en casa de sus suegros  y se dedica desde hace 02  años  a la venta de dulces y galletas por mayor y al detalle a las pulperías y personas que se dedican a este tipo de negocio.
Don Danis clientes son las escuelas y centros básicos, es una persona muy  trabajadora que se levanta temprano a vender sus productos en su motocicleta.
Don Danis está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de bombones, confites, galletas de chocolate, vainilla, chicles, cacahuates, etc.  Quiere ampliar el negocio y surtir una glorieta que está en la escuela de su comunidad, con el apoyo de este préstamo el pretende mejorar un poco sus ingresos, está muy agradecido con PRISMA por el apoyo de su primer crédito.
Don Danis su sueño es tener su propia casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero del 2013.
texts.en:
Danis is 30 years old and married. He has two children who depend on him. His children are 5 and 3 years old. He lives in a community of Choluteca in southern Honduras. He lives in his in-laws' house. For the past 2 years, he has worked selling sweets and cookies on a wholesale and retail basis, to neighborhood stores and to people who dedicate themselves to this kind of work. 

Danis' customers are schools and children's centers. He is a very hard-working person who gets up early to sell his products on his motorcycle. 

Danis is requesting this loan to buy chocolates, candies, chocolate and vanilla cookies, gum, peanuts, etc. He wants to expand his business and stock a kiosk located in the school in his community. With the help of this loan, he intends to improve his income a little bit. He is very grateful to PRISMA for the support with his previous loan. 

Danis' dream is to have his own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - January 2013.

loans.use: to buy chocolates, candies, chocolate and vanilla cookies, gum, peanuts, and other items for his business.

loans.name: Lesly Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lesly es una joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Lesly se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina u  riquísimo Arroz Verde para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Lesly trabaja como asistente administrativo en una televisora de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Lesly se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de estudios, tales como libros, guías didácticas y útiles de escritorio, de esta manera Lesly podrá seguir cursando sus estudios adecuadamente, hasta lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una buena profesional y así al lado de su familia desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Lesly is a young 20-year-old woman who lives in the city of Cañete, in the district of Imperial, with her parents and siblings. She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to excel. Thanks to her own effort and the support of her parents, Lesly is studying the professional degree of Business Administration. 

In her free time she likes to relax by listening to a bit of music, and on some occasions she cooks a delicious Arroz Verde (green rice) plate to share with her family. Lesly works, on her own initiative and with much determination and dedication, as an administrative assistant on a television show in her city. She works every day beginning early in the morning and she is able to work for approximately eight hours. She feels content doing her work and believes it is going well for her because of her good performance and the friendly way she treats others.

Lesly is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help they offer her, she will be able to purchase study materials such as books, teaching guides and stationery. In this way she will be able to continue studying properly, until she achieves her great dream of becoming a good professional and this is how, alongside her family, she would like to succeed.

loans.use: to buy her study materials

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 41 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposa y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta que con el apoyo de su esposa, dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Javier pudo estudiar una pequeña carrera técnica de Mecánica, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Pachamanca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Javier trabaja en su pequeño negocio de alquiler de cabinas de internet, adicionalmente brinda servicios de fabricación de puertas y ventanas de metal, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por sus buenos acabados y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Javier se  encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de muebles para sus computadoras y cartuchos para impresoras, de esta manera Javier tendrá su negocio de internet mejor acondicionado y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues Javier seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia empresa de fabricación metálica.
texts.en:
Javier is a 41-year-old-man. He lives in the city of Chincha with his wife and their two children, whom he loves and who are his main reason in life. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person and with the support of his wife they dedicate all their efforts to get their family ahead. Thanks to his effort, Javier was able to study a small technical degree in Mechanics. In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends and on some occasions cook a delicious Pachamanca (a traditional Peruvian dish) to share with his family. 

On his own initiative, with much persistence and dedication, Javier works in his small business of renting internet booths, additionally he provides services of doors and metal window fabrication. He works every day from early hours, for approximately 10 hours. He is happy with his work and believes it is going well because of his friendly treatment that he provides his customers.

Javier is very thankful to Kiva lenders because thanks to them he will be able to purchase furniture for his computers and cartridges for the printers. This way Javier will have his internet business better equipped and he will be able to take care of his customers. Javier will continue working and making an effort to achieve his big dream of having his own company of metal fabrication.

loans.use: to buy computer furniture and ink cartridges.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Francisco  de  63  años de edad, vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en un barrio de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 15  años al negocio de venta de pan en piezas, cucos, rosquetes, bolitos, semitas de yema, guarachas, polvorón etc.
Don Francisco sus clientes son los amigos y familiares,  así mismo vende su productos en las  comunidad cercanas, su  negocio lo tiene en su casa. 
Don Francisco en un señor emprendedor con deseos de superarse esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de distintas variedades de pan como ser rosquetes, rosquillas, bolitos, semitas de yema, guarachas, polvorines y margaritas.
Don Francisco con el apoyo de este préstamo el pretende abrir nuevas rutas para mejorar sus ingresos y de esta manera desea mejorar su forma de vida y salir adelante, está muy contento de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Don Francisco su sueño es comprarse un nuevo carro.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero del 2013
texts.en:
Francisco is sixty-three years old.  He lives in a house located in the neighborhood of San Lorenzo, in the southern part of Honduras.  He has been working for fifteen years in the business of selling pieces of bread, chocolate breads, donuts, spongy bread rolls, different types of sweet breads, shortbreads, etc.

Francisco's clients are friends and relatives.  He also sells his products in the surrounding communities.  His business is located in his house.

Francisco is an enterprising man with dreams to improve himself.  He is requesting a loan to buy the different kinds of breads, like fried dough, donuts, spongy bread rolls, different types of sweet breads, shortbreads, and salty breads.

With the help of this loan, Francisco aims to open new routes in order to improve his income.  In this way, he wishes to improve his way of life and to move forward.  He is very happy to continue working with Prisma.  

His dream is to buy himself a new car.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras (January 2013)

loans.use: to buy fried dough, donuts, spongy bread rolls, different types of sweet breads, shortbreads, and salty breads for his business.

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.es:
El Señor Gaspar  de  44  años de edad, vive en su casa de habitación con su esposa e hijos ubicada en el barrio en un barrio de San Lorenzo,  al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 05  años al negocio de venta de repuestos para motos.
Don Gaspar sus clientes son los amigos y familiares, que a diario le visitan en su negocio, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de llantas, rines, bovinas, válvulas, motores, guardafangos, villas de motos, etc. que son los repuestos de motocicletas.
Don Gaspar con el apoyo de este préstamo el pretende invertir más en su negocio y tener un buen surtido, su sueño es comprarse un comprar un lote de terreno.
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero del 2013
texts.en:
Gaspar is 44 years old and lives in his home with his wife and children in the neighborhood of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. For five years he has been working in the business of selling replacement parts for motorcycles.

Gaspar’s clients are friends and family members, who visit him daily at his business.

He is requesting the loan to buy tires, wheels, ignition coils, valves, motors, fenders, motorcycle housings, etc., which are replacement parts for motorcycles.

With the support of this loan, Gaspar plans to invest more into his business and to have a good selection of parts. His dream is to buy a plot of land.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- January, 2013

loans.use: to buy tires, wheels, ignition coils, valves, motors, fenders, motorcycle housings, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Jose Luciano

texts.es:
El señor José, de 50  años de edad es casado, tiene dos hijos  que dependen de él, sus hijos tiene edades de 12 y 15 años, vive en una comunidad San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 22  años  a la pesca y venta de pescado de todas las clases.
Don José sus clientes son las personas que se dedican a esta actividad de venta de pescado,  también vende refrescos en su casa, se levanta temprano para pescar en el mar que está cerca de su casa, tiene una lancha pesquera y con este negocio a salido adelante con su familia.
Don José está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de robalo, sardina, camarón y  pescado frescos para ralearlo y secarlo porque tiene varios pedidos de pescado seco, con el apoyo del préstamo el espera resolver su necesidad de financiamiento. 
Don José está muy contento de seguir trabajando con PRISMA, su sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero del 2013.
texts.en:
José is a 50 year married man with two dependent children, ages 12 and 15.  He lives in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.  He owns his own home and for the past 22 years, he has been a fisherman who sells all varieties of fish.  His customers are people that are engaged in fish sales.  He also sells soft drinks at his home.  He arises early in the morning to fish in the sea near his home.  He has a fishing boat and with this business, he has gotten his family ahead.  He is requesting the loan to purchase sea bass, sardines, shrimp, and fresh fish to gut and dry because he has several orders for dried fish.  With the help of this loan, he hopes to resolve his financing needs. José is very happy to continue working with PRISMA, and his dream is to improve his home.  

San Lorenzo- January, 2013

loans.use: to purchase sea bass, sardines, shrimp, and fresh fish for his business.

loans.name: Sandra Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Sandra de 31  años de edad, es casada, tiene cinco hijos  que dependen de ella ,  vive en una comunidad San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 02 Años  a la venta de abarrotería, detergentes, frutas, frescos.
Doña Sandra sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos de la colonia donde vive, es una mujer trabajadora que lucha día a día para salir adelante, es una microempresaria que ha comenzado de cero y esta mejorando su negocio y su vida con las utilidades que obtiene de sus ventas.
Doña Sandra está solicitando el préstamo a Prisma para surtir el negocio porque desea comprar algunos productos que no tiene en su pequeña pulpería como ser embutidos, leche, queso, margarinas, salsas, pastas, frijoles, azúcar, manteca  y refrescos.
Doña Sandra con el apoyo del préstamo espera mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
 Doña Sandra su sueño es tener un negocio grande donde pueda vender de todo.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero del 2013
texts.en:
Sandra is a 31 year old married woman with three dependent children.  She lives in the San Lorenzo community in southern Honduras.  She owns her own home, and for the past two years, she has been selling groceries, detergents, fruit, and soft drinks.  Sandra customers are the neighbors and friends of the community where she lives.  She is a hard-working woman who strives daily to get ahead.  She is a small business owner who started from scratch and is improving her business and her life with the profits obtained from her sales.

Sandra is requesting the loan from Prisma to stock her business.  She wishes to purchase some products that she doesn’t have in her general store such as sausage, milk, cheese, margarine, sauces, pasta, beans, sugar, butter, and soft drinks.  With the support of the loan, she hopes to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.  Her dream is to have a large business where she can sell everything.

loans.use: to purchase sausage, milk, cheese, margarine, sauces, pasta, beans, sugar, butter, and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora Julia está realizando su séptimo crédito en el banco comunal Bankito Progresista, se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy participativa y tiene un gran espíritu de compañerismo. Vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada la Atenas del Ecuador, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos. Su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

La Señora. Julia tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera de 5 hijos, tres de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja y también vive independiente, su último hijo de apenas 9 años estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de propia.

Doña Julia es comerciante de frutas, verduras y granos tiernos, esta actividad la desempeña desde hace 25 años, labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, en su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes, como tiene potreros también vende la hierba. 

Su crédito anterior lo invirtio en la compra de granos de los cuales le dejaron una buena ganancia. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de granos tiernos y frutas para continuar con este negocio. 

Su meta es agrandar mucho más su negocio de frutas.
texts.en:
Julia is on her seventh loan cycle with the communal bank Bankito Progresista. She's known for being a very participative woman with a great team spirit. She lives close to the city center of Cuenca. This city is considered the Athens of Ecuador and has been designated a World Cultural Heritage Site since 1999.

Julia is 45 years old and a single mother of 5 children. Three of her children are married and live independently. Her single son works and also lives independently. Her last son is only 9 years old and studies in a city school. She lives in her own house.

Julia sells fruit, vegetables and tender grains. She has been doing this for 25 years, working from Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule. At home, she breeds chickens and guinea pigs. Since she has pasture lands, she sells the grass as well. 

Her previous credit was used to buy grains which left her with a good profit. Her new credit will be used to buy tender grains and fruits to continue with this business. 

Her goal is to expand her fruit selling business.

loans.use: Buying tender grains and fruits.

loans.name: Marcia Janneth

texts.es:
La Señora Marcia se encuentra el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal Bankito Progresista, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada la Atenas del Ecuador, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos. Su gente es trabajadora, luchadora que siempre están en la busca de una superación personal y familiar, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

La Señora. Marcia tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 6 años de edad que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos de la casa.

A Doña Marcia  le gusta el arte culinario por lo que es propietaria de un local de comida hace 6 años, por el momento solo se dedica a la venta de almuerzos, trabaja de lunes a viernes. Los fines de semana trabaja en un gabinete de belleza en donde esta cogiendo experiencia ya que está estudiando belleza y está a pocos meses de graduarse.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de vivieres para su negocio y también mesas y sillas para su local. 

Su meta es tener su propio gabinete de belleza.
texts.en:
Marcia is on her third loan with the communal bank Bankito Progresista. She lives in the city center of Cuenca, considered the Athens of Ecuador, designated as a World Cultural Heritage Site in 1999, and bathed by 4 rivers. Its people are hard-working and determined who are always seeking for family and self improvement. They still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

Marcia is 27 years old and a single mother of a 6-year old studying in a city school. She doesn't have her own house which is why she lives in her parent's house sharing the house expenses.

Marcia enjoys the culinary arts which is why she has owned her own food business for 6 years. Currently, she only sells lunch meals and works from Monday to Friday. During weekends, she works in a beauty salon where she's building her experience for her beautician studies. She is a few months away from graduation. 

The loan will be used to buy supplies for her business as well as chairs and tables for her locale.

Her goal is to have her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy supplies, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Edith Marlene

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Guillermo Balda se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Edith, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos todos  ellos  ya son mayores de edad, una de ellos aún vive con ella. Su esposo está enfermo y no trabaja.

Ella además de ser una gran madre y esposa también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, también vende en su casa donde tiene unas vitrinas y hasta donde llegan sus clientes a realizar sus compras, trabaja a base de pedidos y es así que la mayoría de la ropa que ella trae de sus viajes es para entregar. Trabaja tres  días a las semanas y  los fines de semana, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene 5  años que se dedica a esta actividad y es así como pueden salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.  Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le brindan los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y que su esposo mejore.
texts.en:
The Guillermo Balda Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Canton Montecristi, which is know for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts that are known at the national and international levels. It is the place with the famous straw sombreros.

Edith lives in this place. She is 56 years old, married, and has six children, all of whom are grown. One of them still lives with her. Her husband is sick and does not work.

Besides being a great mother and wife, she also is a businesswoman, selling all types of clothes. She sells door-to-door. She also sells out of her home, where she has display cases and where her customers come to make their purchases. She works off of orders, so the majority of the clothes that she brings back from her travels is to deliver (to her customers). She works three days during the week, as well as on the weekends. She sells on credit and collects payments every 15 days. She's had this business for five years, and this is how the family has been able to make progress.

This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise such as slacks, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes. She has been with the communal bank since the beginning, and she likes it because of the help the loans always provide her.

Her dreams are to make progress and for her husband to get better.

loans.use: purchase slacks, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Mayra Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra es una socia amable, gentil y sobre todo luchadora ya que busca la manera de sacar adelante a su familia, se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal Bankito Progresista. Vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada la Atenas del Ecuador, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos. Su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

La Señora. Mayra tiene 20 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 1 año de edad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña Mayra es oriunda de la ciudad de Quevedo se encuentra en la ciudad de Cuenca desde hace 5 años que llego en busca de un mejor trabajo, por el momento no se encuentra trabajando por que cuida de su niño que esta pequeñito.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento para los mismos ya que va a iniciar con el negocio de la crianza de pollos. 

Su meta es crecer en su negocio de pollos y tener varios galpones en la cría de estos animales.
texts.en:
Mayra is a kind, gentle and above all determined to get her family ahead. She's on her third loan with the communal bank Bankito Progresista. She lives in the city center of Cuenca, considered the Athens of Ecuador, designated as a World Cultural Heritage Site in 1999, and bathed by 4 rivers. Its residents still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

Mayra is 20 years old, married, and with a child from her marriage. Her husband works in construction as a builder. They don't have their own house, so they are leasing.

Mayra is from the city of Quevedo. She moved to Cuenca five years ago looking for a better job. Currently, she's not working because she takes care of her small boy.

The loan will be used to buy hens and feed to start her own business breeding hens.

Her goal is to expand her hen business and have various animal sheds for breeding.

loans.use: to buy hens and animal feed.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Del Algodonal Group

texts.es:
Julia es uno de los miembros del  grupo Nueva Esperanza del Algodonal
Julia tiene 54 años. Ella es casada y tiene 05 hijos todos mayores de edad. Julia recibe el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos, hace 10 años atiende una cafetería donde vende desayunos a los trabajadores de una entidad, son 15 horas diarias que le dedica a su trabajo, lo que la hace muy feliz porque se siente útil; además de generarle ingresos para solventar sus gastos de alimentación y salud. De otro lado también vende productos de belleza que ofrece dentro de sus clientes de la cafetería, mas adelante quiere tener su propia cafetería y fuente de soda, para eso le gustaría acondicionar un local en su casa. Con el dinero de su préstamo podrá comprar insumos para la preparación de los desayunos que vende. Julia quiere agradecer a los inversionistas de KIVA por permitir el  préstamo a su grupo comunal.Julia es la señora de chompa negra y cartera
* David es el joven que se encuentra en la foto adjunta al lado derecho.
texts.en:
Julia is one of the members of the Nueva Esperanza del Algodonal group.

Julia is 54 years old. She is married and has five children, all of whom are grown. Julia has the support of her husband and her children. she has been managing a cafeteria for 10 years, where she sells breakfasts to the employees of a company. She works 15 hours a day, and this makes her very happy because she feels useful and makes money to pay for food and health expenses. She also sells beauty products to her customers at the cafeteria. Someday, she wants to have her own cafeteria and soda fountain, and for this, she would like to recondition a part of her home. With the money from this loan, she will be able to buy ingredients to prepare the breakfasts she sells. Julia wants to thank the Kiva investors for allowing this group loan.

Julia is the woman in the black sweater with the purse. David is the young man in the small photo to the right.

loans.use: purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Patricia Jacqueline

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Guillermo Balda se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Patricia, tiene 32 años de edad, está separada pero de su relación pasada tiene dos hijos de 15 y de 11 años de edad los dos estudian en colegio.

Ella para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos con el fruto del trabajo honrado se dedica a realizar trabajos domésticos en una casa de la localidad, pero para obtener recursos a parte de lo que gana en su trabajo también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella aprovecha sus ratos libres y fines de semana que tiene más tiempo, deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada quince días, gracias a los créditos pudo empezar con este negocio que le permite ganar algo que le ayuda a salir adelante con sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas y todo tipo de prendas de vestir que ella vende. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella puede salir adelante sola con sus hijos.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Guillermo Balda communal bank meets every 15 days in the Montecristi canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts which are renowned on a national and international level. It is home to the famous Panama hats.

Patricia, 32, lives in this area, she has separated from her partner, but from her previous relation she has two children of 11 and 15 years old, both of whom study in secondary school. To get her children ahead in life, through the fruit of honest work, Patricia carries out domestic work in a house in the area. However, to obtain additional resources other than what she earns in this job, she also works in sales, selling all types of clothes from door-to-door, making the most of her free time and weekends in which she has more time. She sells her merchandise on credit and collects payment every fortnight; it is thanks to loans that she was able to set up this business, enabling her to earn something to help her get her children ahead.

This loan is to buy trousers, shirts and all types of clothes that she sells. She has been with this communal bank from the beginning and she likes it because with the loans that she is able to get ahead in life on her own with her children. Her dream is that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts and all types of clothing.

loans.name: Benita Francisca

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Guillermo Balda se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Benita, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro de ellos  ya son mayores de edad y uno de 5 años que estudia en escuela y es el que aún vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta,  sale a recorrer con su mercadería más que todo en las mañanas ya que a esa hora su hijo está en la escuela y puede salir sin ningún problema, ella deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada quince días, para comprar su mercadería viaja a Guayaquil o a Ambato ya que allá consigue más barato y mejor variedad lo cual le gusta a sus clientes, lleva más de 6 años en este negocio y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas y todo tipo de prendas de vestir. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.

Su sueño es tener un local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
The Guillermo Balda communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its nationally and internationally recognized handicrafts. It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

It is here that Benita lives. She is 53 years old and married. She has five children from that marriage. Four of them are already adults; one, who is five years old, is in school and still lives with Benita. Her husband is a driver.

Benita is a very good mother and wife who works in sales to help with household costs. She sells all types of clothing door-to-door. She goes out with her merchandise mostly in the morning, since her son is in school then and she can go out with no problem. She leaves her merchandise on credit and bills every two weeks. To buy her merchandise, she travels to Guayaquil or to Ambato, since she gets lower prices and better variety there, which her customers like. She has been in this business for more than six years and it has gone very well for her.

This loan is to buy pants, blouses, and all kinds of garments. She is in her third lending cycle in her communal bank, and she likes it because the loans help her.

Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, and all types of garments.

loans.name: Carmen Pilar

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Guillermo Balda se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 8, 5 años y un bebé de 2 meses, los dos mayores estudian en  escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar ya que su esposo en ocasiones no tiene trabajo  se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, compra su mercadería en Guayaquil y Huaquillas ya que allá consigue más barato y con esto le quedan más ganancias, ella empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del banco por lo cual está muy agradecida.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas y todo tipo de prendas de vestir. Lleva 7 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Guillermo Balda Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture. It is also recognized, nationally and internationally, for its artisanship and is the home of the famous Panama hats.  

Carmen lives here. She is 25 years old and married with two children, ages 8 and 5, and a 2 month old baby.  The two older children are in school and her husband is a bricklayer.  She is a very good wife and mother.  Sometimes, her husband doesn’t have work, so in order to help with household expenses, she is engaged in a business in which she sells all types of clothing.  She sells door-to-door, leaving her merchandise on credit and collects payments every eight days.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and Huaquillas because she can get it more cheaply there and in this way, earn more profits.  

She started her business with the first loan that she received from the communal bank for which she is very grateful. This loan is for the purchase of pants, blouses, and all types of clothing.  She is in her seventh loan cycle with the communal bank and she is pleased with it because she started her business with the first loan.  Her dream is to provide better for her children.

loans.use: to purchase of pants, blouses, and all types of clothing.

loans.name: Los Lideres De Ventanilla Alta Group

texts.es:
Rosa es uno de los miembros del  grupo Las Lideres de Ventanilla Alta

Rosa es soltera y tiene 02 hijos pequeños; el padre de sus hijos la apoya con algunos gastos, pero ella tiene que trabajar para solventar otras necesidades, hace 05 años empezó su negocio vendiendo artículos para bebe, para este fin  alquilo un puesto en un mercado de su zona donde tiene su negocio, sus clientas son en su mayoría amas de casa que le compran artículos para bebe como pañales, jabones y lociones. Rosa tiene su negocio cerca de 05 años y gracias a su trabajo puede darle a sus hijos estabilidad económica y apoyarlos en sus estudios, el préstamo solicitado lo usara para comprar andamios y otros enseres para su nuevo local que está acondicionando en su casa donde muy pronto trasladara su negocio. Rosa considera que sus préstamos son muy importantes porque gracias a ellos está cumpliendo todos sus sueños.
¡Rosa agradece su apoyo!
Ella viste polo color marrón y pantalón azul.
texts.en:
Rosa is one of the members of the Las Lideres de Ventanilla Alta (The Leaders of Ventanilla Alta) group.  She is single and has two small children; the father of her children helps her with some expenses, but she has to work in order to pay for other necessities. Five years ago she began her business of selling baby items, and for this purpose she rented a stand in a market in her area where she has her business.  Her customers are mostly housewives who buy baby items like diapers, soaps, and lotions.  

Rosa has had her business for nearly five years and thanks to her work she can give her children financial stability and support them in their studies.  She will use the requested loan to buy scaffolding and other furnishings for her new shop that she is setting up in her house where she will very soon move her business.  Rosa believes that her loans are very important because thanks to them she is accomplishing all of her dreams.  Rosa appreciates your support!

Rosa wears a brown shirt and blue pants.

loans.use: to buy scaffolding and furnishings for her new shop.

loans.name: Nelly Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Guillermo Balda se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro de ellos  ya son mayores de edad y una de 15 años que estudia en colegio y es la única que aún vive con ella. Su esposo es artesano.

Ella para conseguir sus propios ingresos y con esto poder salir adelante hace varios años surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres, la cual con el paso de los años y también con la ayuda de los créditos recibidos ha ido aumentando, en la actualidad además de víveres también vende frutas, legumbres, helados, ciertas bebidas y artículos de bazar, allí mismo también vende ropa de todo tipo lo cual le deja muy buenas ganancias, ella tiene 13 años con su negocio en el cual le ayuda su marido y su hija cuando están desocupados.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres y así surtir aún más su tienda. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque siempre le han ayudado a crecer en su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener otro local en la ciudad.
texts.en:
The Guillermo Balda communal bank meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton. This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and crafts which are recognised nationally and internationally. It is home of the famous Panama hat.

Nelly lives here. She is 51 years old. She is married, having five children from this relationship, four of whom are grown up now. Her youngest child is 15 years old and is going to school. She is the only one of her children still living at home. Nelly’s husband is a craftsman.

In order to earn her own income which she uses to improve her life, several years ago she set up a small grocery store. This store has grown over the years, and with the help of loans that she has received. At present as well as groceries, she also sells fruit, vegetables, ice-cream, some drinks and household items. She also sells all kinds of clothes from the shop, which is very profitable. She has been running the business for 13 years. Her husband and daughter help her out when they are not busy.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies in order for the store to have even more stock. She has been a member since the communal bank started. She likes it as they have helped her to grow her business. 

Her dream is to have another premises in the city.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Rosa Del Rosario

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 9 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 13 Y 5  años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor  en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una recicladora.

Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, la cual le ha sido de mucha ayuda ya que su esposo no gana mucho en su trabajo y los gastos del hogar son muy grandes, en su tienda además de víveres también vende frutas, legumbres, bebidas y artículos de papelería y de bazar. Ella muy de madrugada abre su negocio ya que sus vecinos desde muy temprano le gusta realizar sus compras y es cuando mejores ventas realiza, tiene 3 años con su negocio el cual le gusta porque se gana algo y al mismo tiempo está al tanto de sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir aún más su tienda. Lleva dos años en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios y ayuda que le brinda la institución.

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The July 9 Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Canton Montecristi, which is know for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts that are known at the national and international levels. It is the place with the famous straw sombreros.

Rosa lives in this place. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children who are 14, 13, and five years old. The two older ones are studying in high school, and the little one is in elementary school. Rosa's husband works at a recycling plant.

She has a small grocery store in her home, which has been of great help because her husband does not earn much through his work, and the household expenses are great. In her store, besides basic supplies, she sells fruits, legumes, drinks, stationery, and dollar-store-type items. She opens her store very early in the morning because her neighbors start making their purchases very early, and that is when she makes her best sales. She has had this business for three years, and she likes it because she can earn something, and she can be with her children at the same time.

This loan is to purchase basic supplies to stock her store even more. She has been with the communal bank for two years and she likes it because of the benefits and because of the help that the institution give her.

Her dream is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: purchase supplies.

loans.name: De La Mano Con Jesus Group

texts.es:
Consuelo es miembro del  grupo De la Mano Con Jesús

Consuelo tiene 49 años. Ella es soltera vive sola en una casa alquilada. Consuelo es modista son 45 años que se dedica a la costura, es muy conocida por la zona donde vive y cuenta con muchas clientas, en su taller realiza todo tipo de trabajos como vestidos, blusas y pantalones, también confecciona  cortinas y toda clase de trabajos, el préstamo que ha solicitado lo usara para comprar otra una máquina de coser así podrá renovar la que ya tiene  y podrá recibir más trabajos. Consuelo desea continuar con su trabajo porque es su sustento y se siente feliz  porque tiene contacto con muchas personas que acuden a su taller. Ella esta agradecida por su préstamo y el de su grupo comunal.
En la foto es la cuarta de la izquierda viste blusa de colores y pantalón plomo.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a member of the group “De la Mano Con Jesús”. She is single and lives alone in a rented house. 

Consuelo is a tailor; she has been doing this work for 45 years. She is very well-known throughout the area and has many customers. In her shop, she does all kind of work, like dresses, blouses, and pants. She also makes curtains and all types of things.

The loan that she has requested will be used to buy another sewing machine so that she can renovate the one that she has and be able to get more work. 

Consuelo hopes to continue with her work, because it is her livelihood and she feels happy because she has contact with many people who come to her shop. She is grateful for her loan and that of her communal bank.

In the photo, she is fourth from the left, wearing a colored blouse and gray pants.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Rosario Paulina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Guillermo Balda se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosario, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos  de ellos  ya son mayores de edad y una niña de 6  años que estudia en escuela y es la única que aún vive con ella. Su esposo es artesano.

Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí además de víveres también vende frutas, legumbres, artículos de papelería y de bazar, lo cual le deja muy buenas ganancias sobretodo la papelería ya que viven cerca de un colegio y sus ventas siempre son muy buenas, ella tiene 5 años con su negocio el cual le deja muy buenas satisfacciones ya que allí ella se gana algo sin salir de su casa.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres y artículos de papelería surtir aún más su tienda y su papelería. Lleva 4 ciclos en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios y ayuda que le brinda la institución.

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Guillermo Balda Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Canton Montecristi, which is know for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts that are known at the national and international levels. It is the place with the famous straw sombreros.

Rosario lives in this place. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children. Two of the children are already grown, and there is a girl who is six years old and studying in school. She is the only child who lives with Rosario. Rosario's husband is an artisan.

Rosario has a small grocery store in her home. In addition to basic supplies, she also sells fruits, legumes, stationery and dollar-store-type items. The thing that generates the best income, overall, is the stationery because they live close to a school and sales are always very good. Rosario has had this business for five years, which has given her great satisfaction because she always earns something there without having to leave her house.

This loan is to purchase supplies and stationery items in order to stock her store and stationery even more. She has been through four cycles in the communal bank, and she likes it because of the benefits and the help that the bank gives her.

Her dream is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: purchase supplies and stationery.

loans.name: Bondades De Mujer Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! Este es el grupo Bondades de Mujer

Isabel tiene 50 años, ella es separada y tiene 03 hijos mayores de edad. Isabel tiene una bodega en su casa, donde vende productos de abarrotes,  bebidas y golosinas. Ella trabaja en su bodega todos los días, también cuenta con  el apoyo de sus hijos que atienden el negocio, gracias a su trabajo  ha podido apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan continuar con sus estudios, esta agradecida por sus préstamos por que le han permitido abastecer su negocio, en esta oportunidad usara su préstamo para la compra de productos de abarrotes. Isabel sueña con tener una bodega  más grande y surtida,  para lograrlo desea seguir trabajando y ahorrando.
Isabel es la 3ra de la izquierda, está sentada y tiene cartera color ploma.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru! This is the "Kindness of Women" [Bondades de Mujer] group.

Isabel is 50 years old, separated, and has three older children. She has a store in her house where she sells grocery products, drinks, and sweets. She works at the store every day and also counts on the support of her children who help look after the business. Thanks to her work, she has been able to support her children so they can continue with their studies. 

Isabel is grateful for her loans because they have allowed her to stock her business. At this opportunity she will use her loan to buy grocery products. Isabel's dream is to have a bigger and better stocked business. In order to achieve this dream, she wishes to continue working and saving.

In the photo, Isabel is the third from the left, seated with a dark blue purse in her lap.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Elsa Mercedes

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Guillermo Balda se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Elsa, tiene 33 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 8, 7 y 4 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es ayudante en un bus de transporte.

Ella es artesana ya que elabora sillas, mesas, juegos de muebles  y varios objetos más de mimbre que es un material utilizado por los habitantes de esta zona para elaborar objetos muy típicos del lugar y que son muy apreciados por los turistas, ella una vez que tiene elaborados sus productos los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar para llevarlos a otras ciudades donde se venden a muy buen precio, ella lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta labor misma que aprendió de su papá y que hoy le permite ganarse la vida honradamente.

Este crédito es para comprar  mimbre que es la materia prima con la que ella trabaja. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que el banco le brinda.

 Su sueño es que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en: The Guillermo Balda communal bank meets every fortnight in Cantón Montecristi, a region known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its nationally and internationally renowned handicrafts, such as the famous toquilla straw hats.  It is also home to 33-year-old Elsa, who lives with her partner, with whom she has 3 children of 8, 7 and 4 years of age, the two eldest of whom are at school.  Her partner works as a bus conductor.  She is a craftswoman who manufactures chairs, tables, sets of furniture and various other products from wicker, a material widely used by the people of the region to make typical local objects which are greatly appreciated by tourists.  She delivers her finished products to traders who come to the region to take them to other cities where they are sold for considerable sums.  Having learned the trade from her father, Elsa has worked for over 10 years in the business and is now able to earn a decent living from it.  This loan is for the purchase of wicker, the primary raw material with which she works.  She has been a member of the communal bank for three cycles and likes it because of the help which it provides for her.  Her dream is that her children never want for anything.

loans.use: to buy wicker.

loans.name: Maryuri   Kattiusca

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 9 De Julio que reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Maryuri, tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene un hijo de cinco años que estudia en una escuela de la localidad.
 
Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar y salir adelante sola por el bien de su hijo y el suyo propio, ella tiene una distribuidora de agua en bidón, los mismos que entregan a domicilio en una camioneta de su propiedad, con ella trabaja una persona que es la encargada de realizar las entregas a domicilio y a quien le paga por su trabajo un sueldo mensual. También tiene un local en la ciudad de Manta en el cual vende ropa de todo tipo y zapatos. Lleva en estos negocios por más de 15 años y siempre le ha ido muy bien y sale adelante sola con su hijo.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos y agua en bidón. Lleva dos créditos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The communal bank 9 De Julio meets every other week in Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its craftwork, which is recognized national and internationally, as well as for its straw hats. Here is where Maryuri lives. She's a 37-year old woman, single and mother of one child, who is five and attends a local school. 

She's a very determined woman who likes to work and get ahead on her own for their well-being. She runs a business that does home delivery of water drums using a van of her property. Home deliveries are under the responsibility of an employee, to whom she pays a monthly salary. She also has a store in the town of Manta, where she sells all kinds of clothes and shoes. She has been in these businesses for over 15 years and has always been successful and able to get ahead with her son. 

She plans to use the requested loan to buy clothes, shoes and water drums. She already has two loans with this communal bank and is satisfied with the help she receives. Her dream is to provide her son with the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and water drums.

loans.name: Carmen Judith

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 9 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 21, 19 Y 16  años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en universidad y el menor  en colegio. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, electrodomésticos y muebles por catálogos, ella enseña los catálogos a sus clientes para que ellos seleccionan lo que desean y luego ella realiza el pedido a la distribuidora.  También vende productos de Esika, Lebel, y Sayson (perfumes, cremas, bisutería entre otras cosas), entrega a crédito y que cobra cada ocho días, lleva 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, cremas, perfumes, cosméticos y electrodomésticos. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para financiar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The comunal bank 9 De Julio convenes every fifteen days in Montecristi canton.  The city is known for its rich pre colonial culture and artistry that is recognized on a national and international level.  It is also the home of the famous panama hat.  

This is where Carmen calls home.  She is 39 years old, married, and has three children of 21, 19, and 16 years of age.  The two oldest attend university and the youngest is in high school.  Her husband is a chauffer.  

She is a very good mother and wife.  To help her husband with the expenses she makes a living in retail.  She sells all styles of clothing, home appliances, and furniture through catalogs.  She shows her customers the catalogs so they can find what they like and later she will place the order through the distributor.  She also brand name products such as Esika, Lebel, and Sayson (perfumes, creams, and imitation jewelry among others).  She allows her customers to pay on credit and she collects every eight days.  She has been doing this for the last four years and has been doing very well.  

She seeks this loan to purchase clothes, creams, perfumes, cosmetics, and home appliances.  This is her third loan from the comunal bank and she likes it because the loans are of great help to her business.  

Her dream is for her children to become good working professionals.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, creams, perfumes, cosmetics, and home appliances.

loans.name: Martina Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 9 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Martina, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 17, 16, 14 y 12  años que estudian en el colegio. Su esposo trabaja de albañil.

Ella con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar hace más de 4 años empezó un pequeño negocio, vende bebidas y comidas rápidas como corviches, empanadas, ceviches de pescado y camarón, ella alquila un pequeño local muy cerca del mercado de la localidad lugar donde llega mucha gente y sus ventas son muy buenas, trabaja todos los días en las mañanas vendiendo los deliciosos ceviches y en la tarde sus otros alimentos, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado, camarón, plátano y otros víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ahora es as fácil financiar su negocio.

Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
The “9th of July” Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisan craftsmanship, which is known at a national and international level. This is the source of the famous 'Panama' hats.

Martina resides here. She is 38 years old, married, and from this relationship there are 4 children, ages 17, 16, 14, and 12, who study in the local school. Her husband works as a builder.

For the purpose of earning something on her own, and thereby helping her husband with household expenses, over 4 years ago, Martina began a small business, selling drinks and quick meals such as tuna cakes, meat pies, and raw fish and shrimp ceviches. She rented a small stall very close to the local market, a place where many people come to shop, and her sales are very good. Martina works every morning, selling her delicious ceviches, and every afternoon selling her other dishes. Her children help with the business.
 
This loan is for purchasing fish, shrimp, plantains and other foods necessary for preparing the meals. This is her communal bank's 2nd loan cycle. She likes the bank because, thanks to these loans, it is now easier to finance her business.

Martina's dream is that her children should finish their studies and become upstanding persons.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, plantains and other ingredients for the meals she sells.

loans.name: Noha Group

texts.en:
Noha group consists of four women from Aden, Yemen. They applied for a 90,000 YER loan from AMB to purchase mobile phone recharge cards for resale.

Ghada is a 31-year-old married woman with five children. She is the leader of the group. She has been selling phone recharge cards for a year since she got a loan from AMB. 

Her business goes well, and she wants now to purchase and resell recharge cards of all mobile phone operators in Yemen. She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER. Ghada looks forward to improving her family's living standards, using the profits she will earn.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone recharge cards for resale.

loans.name: Nour Al-Hadi Group

texts.en:
This group is called Nour Al-hadi which consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.
Shafiqa is a 33-year-old married woman who lives in Sana`a. She has been a tailor for many years. She works hard to improve her business. She applied for a loan of 30000 YER from AMB to buy sewing products to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy sewing products to increase her income.

loans.name: Omr- Al-Hodeida Group

texts.en:
Omr- AL-Hodeida group consists of four women from AL-Hodeida, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 80,000 YER to purchase clothes and cosmetics for resale.

Fadmah is a 23-year-old single woman. She has lived with her mother since her parents divorced. She couldn’t continue studying in school because she needs to work to help her mother in paying for food and rent. 

She decided to be a door-to-door seller. She has been selling clothes, perfumes and incense. Fadmah asked for a loan of 20,000 YER to purchase more clothes, incense and perfumes for resale. She hopes to earn profits and help her hard-working mother in improving their living standards.

loans.use: to buy clothes incense and perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Fulla Group

texts.en:
Fulla group consists of four women from Aden, Yemen. They applied for a 160,000 YER loan from AMB to buy clothes for resale.

Jamila is a 51-year-old married woman with five children, and the leader of the group. She is illiterate and lives with her husband and children in Aden. Her family is one of the low-income households in Aden. 

She has been carrying out a business of purchasing and reselling women's and children's clothes for the last three years. She is a door-to-door seller. After she got enough experience in her business, she wanted to expand her business and start targeting new clients from different quarters in Aden, but she doesn’t have enough money. Therefore, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER. 

Jamila hopes to earn large profits in order to help her family pay for all their living expenses and improve their standards of living.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to resell.

loans.name: Om-Emetnan Group

texts.en:
Om-Emetnan group consists of three women from Aden, Yemen. They asked for a 120,000 YER loan from AMB to purchase clothes for resale.

Monerah is a 33-year-old married woman, and she is the leader of the group. She is illiterate and lives with her husband and children. 

For four years, she has been carrying on a small business. She is a door-to-door seller. She purchases and resells women's clothes, especially "dera'a"' and "jalabiate" -- traditional, light dresses worn mostly in the warm areas in Yemen. 

Monerah has requested a loan of 50.000 YER to expand her business and sell clothes to new clients in other areas and places in her city. Monerah  hopes to earn large profits in order to improve the standard of living for her family and purchase a house.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Karina Jahaira

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 9 De Julio que reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señorita Karina, tiene 22 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de los padres. 

Ella aprendió belleza y arreglo personal en una academia de la ciudad por lo cual obtuvo su título de artesana en esta rama, como es una mujer muy trabajadora con lo que aprendió en la academia poco a poco ha ido adecuando un salón de belleza, empezó con muy poco pero con la ayuda de los créditos ha ido comprando las herramientas e instrumentos necesarios para realizar sus trabajos, ella realiza cortes de cabello, tinturados y muchos trabajos más, lleva 5 años con su salón y gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo se está forjando un buen porvenir.

Este crédito es para comprar tintes, tratamientos capilares, esmaltes y otros cosméticos que ella necesita para su trabajo. Lleva cinco ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener el mejor salón de belleza de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The July 9 Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Canton Montecristi, which is know for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts that are known at the national and international levels. It is the place with the famous straw sombreros.

Karina lives in this place. She is 22 years old, single, and lives in her parents' home.

She learned cosmetology and personal care at a school in the city where she obtained her cosmetology license. She is a very hardworking woman. Little by little, with what she learned at the school, she has been building a beauty salon. She started with very little, but with the help of loans, she has been buying the necessary tools and instruments for her work. She gives haircuts, dyes hair, and provides many other services. She has had her salon for five years, and thanks to her effort, she is shaping a good future for herself.

This loan is to purchase dyes, hair treatments, nail polishes, and other cosmetics that she needs for her work. She has been with the communal bank for five cycles and she likes it because of the help that the loans provide her.

Her dream is to have a better beauty salon in the city.

loans.use: purchase dyes, hair treatments, nail polishes, and other cosmetics.

loans.name: Wafa'a Group

texts.en:
Wafa'a  group consists of four women from Aden, Yemen. They applied for a 145,000 YER loan from AMB to purchase clothes for resale.

Wafa'a is a 35-year-old married woman who has three children. She is illiterate and lives with her husband and children. Her husband works very hard and does his best to cover all the family's needs.

She wants to help her husband and provide better living conditions for her family. She became a door-to-door clothes seller.  At first, she was selling  clothes for others and got money for that. After she had enough experience, she wanted to start her own business. 

She would like to purchase and resell women's clothes, especially "dera'a"' and "jalabiate" -- traditional, light dresses worn mostly in warm areas in Yemen. Wafa'a has requested a loan of 40,000 YER. She hopes to earn large profits in order to improve the standard of living for her family and start selling electronics and cell phones.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Seguras Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Seguras Hacia el Futuro
Paula tiene 52 años. Ella es casada y tiene 02 hijos. El esposo de Paula es pescador y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos familiares. Paula es enfermera de profesión y trabaja de forma particular atendiendo a pacientes que contratan sus servicios, hace 04 años cuida un paciente adulto, los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de comida rápida, tiene un carrito sanguchero ubicado en su casa donde vende salchipapas y hamburguesas que ella misma prepara. Paula es muy trabajadora y gracias a ello puede ayudar a su esposo para que sus hijos tengan buenos estudios y mejor calidad de vida, Paula usara este préstamo para invertir en su negocio de comida rápida con la compra de insumos. El sueño de Paula es tener un negocio familiar y crecer como empresa.
En la foto es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
This is the group “Seguras Hacia el Futuro”.

Paula is 52 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Paula’s husband is a fisherman, and the income he receives isn’t sufficient to cover the family’s expenses. 

Paula is a nurse by profession, and she works in a special way, attending to patients who hire her services. She has been caring for an adult patient for 4 years. 

On the weekends, she works selling fast food. She has a food cart located in her house where she sells fried potatoes with hot dogs and hamburgers that she prepares herself.

Paula is very hardworking, and thanks to this, she can help her husband so that their children have a good education and a better quality of life. 

Paula will use this loan in order to invest in her fast food business with the purchase of supplies. Paula’s dream is to have a family business and to expand as an enterprise. 

In the photo, she is the first one on the left hand side.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Azeia Group

texts.en:
Azeia group consists of four women from Aden, Yemen. They applied for a 120.000 YER loan from AMB to buy clothes for resale.
Azeia is a 50-year-old married woman with 15 children. She is illiterate and lives with her husband and children in a poor area in Aden. They are one of the low-income households in Aden. They suffer from bad living conditions. She decided not to give up and to start up a small business. She wants to be a door-to–door saleswoman, but she needs the capital to purchase woman and kid's clothes for resale; therefore she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER. Azeia hopes to earn large profits in order to help her family to pay for all their living expenses, especially school and university fees.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Julio

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 9 De Julio que reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive el señor Carlos, tiene 49 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  pero no han podido tener hijos. Su esposa es artesana.

Él es un hombre muy trabajador que para llevar el pan diario a su hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta, también vende en su  casa donde su esposa le ayuda con sus ventas ya que allí ella tiene un pequeño salón de belleza y aprovecha de mostrar la mercadería de su marido. Trabaja todos los días ya sea  en las mañanas o en las tardes, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil y también viaja hasta Colombia para comprar la mejor mercadería para sus clientes.
