Tiene más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad y tiene mucha clientela.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva dos créditos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.
 
Sus sueños seguir adelante en su negocio y en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
The July 9th communal bank meets every 15 days in Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handcrafts which are recognized at a national and international level.  It is also home to the famous straw hats.

This is where Señor Carlos lives.  He is 49 years old and has a common-law marriage, but he was not able to have children.  His wife is a craftswoman.

He is a very hard-working man who, in order to bring the daily bread home, makes a living through commerce.  He sells all types of clothing and his method of selling is by going door to door, but he also sells from his home where his wife helps with his sales because she has a small beauty salon there and takes advantage of showing off her husband's merchandise.  He works every day either in the mornings or in the afternoons, sells on credit to his customers, and charges every 15 days.  He buys his merchandise in Guayaquil and also travels to Colombia to buy better merchandise for his customers.  Carlos has spent more than 20 years making a living with this activity and has many customers.

He is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.  He has two loans from his communal bank and he likes it because the interest is low.  His dreams are to continue moving forward in his business and in his family life.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Arafat 3 Group

texts.en:
Arafat 3 is a group of two women and two men from al-Hodeida, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 170,000 YER from AMB to purchase clothes and vegetables for resale and repair a motorcycle.

Joma'a is a 41-year-old married woman with seven children. When her husband became unable to work because of his illness four years ago, she had the responsibility of taking care of her family. Since then she has been selling perfumes and incense. She is a door-to-door seller. 

When Joma'a heard about AMB, she immediately applied for a loan of 50,000 YER to help her keep going on her business and buy more clothes. Joma'a looks forward to selling to new clients in different quarters and making considerable profits.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing incense and perfumes for resale

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is 53 years old, and is married with two sons. She and her husband have been running a business of selling beverages for 22 years. She started this business to cover her family expenses. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Huong is requesting a loan to expand her business by purchasing a large quantity of soft drinks to restock her store and increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of beverages to restock her store.

loans.name: Khawader Group

texts.en:
Khawader is a group of  three woman from Aden, Yemen. They applied for a 90,000 YER loan from AMB to renovate their houses.

Khawader is 33 years old; a married woman with three children. She is illiterate. After she got the first loan from AMB a year ago, she started up a small business as a door-to-door woman's clothes seller. She made a good profit, but she couldn’t accumulate a considerable sum of money because she spent most of it to help her husband to pay for all their family living expenses. 

Khawader needs now to renovate her very old house, but she doesn’t have enough money. Therefore she asked for a loan of 30,000 YER to help her renovate her house. She hopes that after completing house renovation she will be able to accumulate a sum of money to expand her business and start selling clothes in more quarters.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Al-Rabia'a Group

texts.en:
Al-rabia'a is a four–member female group form Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB to buy female summer clothes, a closet and renovate a house. 

Nasreen, a 27-year-old engaged woman, is the leader of the group. She completed her education up to the eighth class in Aden. Aden is one of the hottest governates in Yemen, so most of the residents wear summer clothes. Nasreen has started selling women's summer clothes to her co-workers and neighbors, and has been doing this for six months.

She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER to buy more clothes so as to expand her business. She hopes that she can use the profit she will make to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Naema Group

texts.en:
Naema is a group of four women from Aden, Yemen. They applied for a 110,000 YER loan.

Saher is 27 years old, married, and has a 5-year-old child. She has been selling cosmetics in her neighborhood for more than a year since she was granted a loan to buy cosmetics. This  business helped her to start building a room, using the profits she made. 

Now, Saher needs to pay for roofing, so she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER. Saher hopes to finish building her house and start selling high-quality cosmetics after she accumulates a large sum of money.

loans.use: to pay for roofing.

loans.name: Joaquín Humberto

texts.es:
Don Joaquín tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, es el único varón de su numerosa familia, él tenía que ayudarle a su padrastro a cuidar los animales y en las labores agrícolas. A los 18 años de edad se caso y formo su propia familia. Poco a poco fue comprando sus animales de lo que ahorraba de los trabajos agrícolas. Los insumos agrícolas, los compra en una ciudad que esta a cuatro kilómetros de su casa, luego traslada los insumos en el autobús hasta un lugar en donde los va a traer un carretero, por que el autobús no llega hasta su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una vaca lechera. Con la compra de la vaca, tendrá otra fuente de ingresos para su familia y poderles brindar el estudio a sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
Joaquín is 59 years old, married with three children. He has worked in agriculture from an early age, since as the only son in his large family he had to help his stepfather to care for the animals and in agricultural pursuits.

When he was 18 years old he got married and started his own family. Little by little he was buying animals from what he saved from farm work. He buys his farming supplies in the city which is four kilometers from his home, later taking the supplies on the bus to a place for cart drivers, because the bus does not go past his home.

The loan that he is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy a dairy cow. With the purchase of a cow he will have another source of income for his family and he can provide studies for the young children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to provide another source of income for his family

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Don pedro tiene 50 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Hace 38 años aproximadamente, él trabaja en las labores agrícolas su padre fue quien le enseño. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materiales para mejorar su vivienda. Él desea ampliarla y construirle otra pared; para ofrecer una vivienda digna a su familia, que puedan vivir cómodamente y seguros.
texts.en: Pedro is 50, married and the father of three children.  He has been working for approximately 38 years in agricultural labouring, having learned his trade from his father.  The loan which he is seeking from Fundación Campo is to buy materials to improve his home by extending it and building another wall.  He wants to provide a decent home for his family so that they can live comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve his home.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to restock her store.

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en:
Ran is an original citizen from Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She is 27 years old and married and blessed with three children who depend on her. One of them is in school and the remaining two are too young for schooling. 

To deal with daily costs of living, she and her husband manage two hectares of rice farming and another two hectares of sesame. Sometimes, for extra income, her husband also uses his spare time to work for others for a fee. 

The business that she has engaged in for five years has helped her to earn up to 22,500 KHR per day. Ran has been with VisionFund for three loan cycle already. She has used her loans wisely to upgrade her living conditions as well as to maintain her business. 

Now, in a group of three, she is a leader. The entire loan amount of her group is 3,800,000 KHR. Ran, whose loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR, is going to spend her loan on paying those she has hired to harvest her crop and purchasing fertilizer and insecticide for her sesame field. 

She hopes to gather her production in a timely way so that she can make more profit and sustain her living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay harvesting fees.

loans.name: Neam's Group

texts.en:
Age 37, Neam is a local farmer residing in Battambang Province’s Moung Russey district. Her family consists of five members including her three children; she needs to cater for all of her children as two of them are students while the remaining one is helping with the household chores. Growing rainy-season rice on three hectares of farmland and planting sesame on two hectares of farmland are the main source of her family's income. Besides helping on the farm, her husband also uses his free time to work as motor-taxi driver to supplement their income. She has 10 years of experiences in this business, from which she is able to earn up to 24,700 KHR per day. 

This is the fourth loan cycle for Neam and the other three co-borrowers with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The previous loans have helped improve her lifestyle and improve her business. She also has repaid back her loan with success. Now, she and two of her fellow group members are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each whereas the remaining member is seeking 1,000,000 KHR. 

Neam wants her portion to pay harvesting fees and to purchase sesame seed as well as insecticide for her sesame farm. She expects to gain a good yield on time so she can double her income and keep better living conditions for her family and especially provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: To pay harvesting fees and to purchase sesame seed.

loans.name: Tham

texts.en:
Tham is a 60-year-old mother of 10 children living in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She is a local rice farmer on four hectares of farmland. She has support from her husband who sometimes works for others for a fee to make additional income. Tham has been in this business for 30 years. 

Tham has never received a loan from VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is seeking her first loan. 

Tham will use her loan to buy gasoline for water pumping, fertilizer, and insecticide to support her rice field. She hopes to grow her rice seasonably so that she can multiply her crop production and gain more income for her family’s sake.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for water pumping, fertilizer, and insecticide.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van, age 51, is the mother of two schoolchildren and a rural villager from Thmor Koul district of Battambang Province. To meet the daily basic needs of the family, she and her husband grow rice on four hectares of farmland. To supplement the family’s income, her husband also works for others for pay. 

Van has 13 years' experience in her current business. Her main challenge is low yields caused by insects. To overcome this challenge, she is applying for her second loan from VisionFund (Cambodia). She has repaid her original loan, which helped her to support her rice farm and return a decent income to cover the family's daily expenses. She will use the current loan to buy gasoline for pumping water and to buy insecticide to reduce the loss of crops on her rice field. Van will also use a portion of the loan to fix her motorbike, which she uses to commute to the rice field. She hopes to make more income so she can keep improving her living and supporting her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and to insecticide

loans.name: Peth's Group

texts.en:
Peth, 46, is a widow and has one son to cater for as he is still in school. She and her son live in Mongkul Borey district of Battambang province. To tackle the family's hardships, she sells grocery items in order to get a daily income for her son’s sake. She has been engaged in this business for 15 years and is able to earn up to 25,000 KHR. 

This is not the first cycle loan for Path as she has been with VisionFund for three cycles already. She has used the previous loans with success and they have helped her to maintain her standard of living. 

Now, she is forming a group of two to apply for a new loan with VisionFund. The total loan amount of her entire group is 1,800,000 KHR. Path, whose loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR, will use her loan to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes this purchase will help her to replenish her items on time and make a good income for her living standard as well as for her son’s education.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Originally from Dambae district of Kampong Cham Province, Thy is 31 years old and one of the breadwinners in the family which consists of two sons who are under 18 years old. She helps her family to survive through a pig-raising business in which she has been engaged for five years. To supplement the family's income, her husband also helps to earn additional income via charging batteries at home. 

This is the fourth-cycle loan for Thy with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has completely paid back the previous loan and it was successful in ensuring her current business is in good shape. This has empowered her and she now feels she can sustain her living conditions in a proper manner. 

Now, she is seeking for a new loan of 2,500,000 KHR. She is going to spend this loan on buying ten more pigs to raise and pig feed. She hopes she can enlarge this business to a larger scale, and fatten her pigs so she can sell them at a good price.

loans.use: To buy ten more pigs to raise and pig feed.

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en: Originally from Ek Phnom District of Battambang Province, Sor is 41 years old and married. She has seven children, four of whom are students while her other three daughters are working in Thailand. Sor earns a living through rice farming and fishing. She has been engaged in these businesses for 20 years. Sor has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for five cycles and has successfully paid back her previous loans. Her living conditions have improved progressively as a result of her wise use of her loans. Now she and her group member are seeking 1,400,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. Sor will spend her loan on harvesting fees for her rice field and to buy fishing nets. She hopes to receive a higher yield and catch more fishes, so she can multiply her income to sustain her current living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting fees and to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Residing under a wooden house located in Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Mey is a father blessed with three kids. One of his children is at school but the other two are too young. 

Similar to the rest of his neighborhood, he grows rice and is also a house builder. He has been involved with this business for 13 years and it enables him to earn up to 23,400 KHR per day. 

He has been involved with VisionFund, Kiva's partner, for three loan cycles. Through these loans he feels confident that he can improve the condition of his life. 

This cycle is his fourth loan and he requests 4,000,000 KHR. He is going to use the entire loan to fix his house. He hopes to mend his house on time so that he no longer has to worry about the cold weather which affects his children.

loans.use: to fix his house

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
A rural farmer from Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, Sokha is a young 24-year-old mother who has only an eight-month-old daughter. Her main sources of income are from paddy rice planting and pig-raising. This business, which she has been in for two years, earns her about 15,500 KHR per day. 

This is the first cycle for Sokha’s group which consists of three female members. They are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. Sokha, as the group leader, is going to use her loan to buy more pigs to raise, pig feed, and also to build a pigpen. She hopes this loan will help her to run her pig-raising business smoothly and increase her income for her kid’s sake.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise, pig feed and to build a pigpen.

loans.name: Chamroeun's Group

texts.en: Chamroeun is 62 years old and married with four children. The rest of his family is living in Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. To overcome family hardships, he and his wife do rice farming and animal husbandry (duck and chicken). He has engaged in this business for 40 years. Chamroeurn, a fifth-cycle client, joined a group of two to apply for a new loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. He has paid back his past loans with success and it has improved his living condition. Now, he and his co-borrower are applying for 800,000 KHR each. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to pay for harvesting fee and to buy feed for his duck and chicken raising business. He hopes to make more income from both business so that he can upgrade his lifestyle gradually.

loans.use: to pay for the harvesting fee and to buy feed for his ducks and chickens

loans.name: Oeurb's Group

texts.en:
Oeurb, 33, is rural villager from Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She has four children that count on her as they are still in school. To survive basic needs in her household, she catches fish for sale and is also a fruit seller. Her husband also helps to earn additional income via working as a mine clearer. Oeurb has been involved in her current business for 20 years.  

This is the seventh loan cycle for Oeurb with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has used her past loan to help her to cover daily necessary expenses and to send her remaining young child to school. Now, she forms a group of three members including her; she is the leader and is seeking 1,400,000 KHR. For Oeurb, she will use her loan to buy a cast net to support her fish-catching business and to buy more fruits for resale. She hopes this purchase will support her business timely so that she can make more income to support her living and her children’s education until the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy a cast net and fruit to sell

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: A 39-year-old mother originally from Sangke district of Battambang province, Sokha is a single woman who makes her living through growing paddy rice and working for others for a fee. She has been involved in this business for 10 years and is able to earn up to 22,200 KHR per day. Sokha’s first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) was three cycles ago. She has completely paid back the loan and it has sustained her lifestyle. This cycle, she forms a group of two to seek for a new loan in amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy 14 sacks of paddy rice for resale. She hopes this purchase will help her to stock more rice and sell it during the high in order to return her a good income to improve her living condition, to keep her children in school, and to expand her business into a larger scale.

loans.use: To buy rice for resale

loans.name: Chakriya's Group

texts.en: A young widowed mother of one daughter residing in Sangke district of Battambang province, Chakriya struggles to provide for her family through porridge selling. The current business that she has been with for 7 years earns her about 41,000 KHR per day. Now, she joins a group with other three members to apply for a new loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner.  She and two of her co-borrowers are in their fourth cycle while a remaining member is in her seventh cycle of loans. She has succeeded in paying back her entire past loan with a good progress of her lifestyle as well as her business. Now, she and the rest of her joint member are seeking for 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to buy various kind of beverages for resale. She hopes that she can earn more income from her current business so that she can sustain her living condition.

loans.use: To buy various kinds of beverages for resale

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en:
Leng, 52, and a father of four kids, is a farmer who manages to overcome the burden of providing daily food for his family through rice and sesame growing. He is able to earn up to 16,000 KHR per day on average from the business that he has been involved in for four years. 

Now, in a group of two, Leng and his co-borrower are in their first cycle of borrowing with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. He is a group leader. Both of them are seeking for 1,000,000 KHR each. Leng is going to spend his portion to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and to pay plowing fees. He highly hopes that he can increase his income even more so that he can have a better living and build a new house for his kids.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Chreong's Group

texts.en: Chreong, 32 years old and married, is the father of a small child, living in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To provide decent food for his child, he and his wife work on two hectares of rice farm and another two hectares of sesame fields. The current business, which he has been with for seven years, earns him about 25,000 KHR per day. Chreong’s prior loan was his original loan from VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. It has helped him to promote good living conditions for his family. Now, he and one of his co-borrowers are seeking 1,200,000 KHR each, while the remaining one is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to pay for harvesting costs for his rice production and to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and sesame seed. He hopes to bring in his harvest on time and sell at a high price, so he can treble his income and maintain his living standards.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting costs and to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and sesame seed for his farm.

loans.name: Sinoun's Group

texts.en:
Sinoun, a married mother of one schoolboy and three young kids, is 31 years old and one of the breadwinners in her household. To support her living, she and her husband grow three kinds of cash crops, including rice, sesame, and beans. Sinoun’s main source of income returns her about 13,800 KHR per day from the current business that she has been with for ten years. 

Including this cycle, Sinoun is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the successful loan that she has repaid back completely, her living conditions keep improving gradually. For this cycle, Sinoun is seeking 1,000,000 KHR. It is the same loan amount as her fellow group member, too. 

Sinoun, as a group leader, will use her portion to pay for plowing fees and to buy seed for her sesame field. She hopes this purchase will help her to grow her sesame on time and get back to her a triple output, so she can set aside some money to build a new house for her children.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and to buy seed.

loans.name: Chork's Group

texts.en: The 55-year-old father of five children, two of whom are in school, Chork is a local farmer residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. He grows rice and sesame with the help from his wife in order to meet their daily living costs. He has been engaged in this business for 12 years and is able to earn up to 20,000 KHR per day. This is the fourth loan cycle for Chork with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The past loans helped him to manage his living in a proper way and gradually to build better support for his business. Now, he is part of a group of three. His two fellow group members are second-time borrowers. He is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR, and each of them is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. As the leader, he is going to use his loan to pay for harvesting costs, to buy seed and insecticide, and to pay for labor fees. He hopes to harvest his cash crop on time and treble his yield, so that he can make a good living and replant his crop in season and maintain his living standards.

loans.use: to buy seed and insecticide, and to pay for harvesting costs on his farm.

loans.name: Saroeurn's Group

texts.en: Saroeurn is a diligent farmer who needs to care for the one of her five children who is still in school. Her main source of income is from rice farming. She is a widow who is raising her children alone. During her spare time, she also works for others for pay, in order to avoid family hardship. By engaging in this business for 35 years, she has been able to earn up to 8,000 KHR per day and to save about 3,000 KHR per day. Her first loan from VisionFund was three cycles ago. She has already fully paid back her entire loan, and it has successfully injected cash into her business, improving her living standards. Now she is part of a group of two, applying for a new loan from VisionFund. She is applying for 600,000 KHR, while her fellow group member is seeking 500,000 KHR. Saroeurn is going to use part of her portion of the loan to buy potash for her farm and part of it to repair her house. She hopes this loan will help her to grow her rice in a timely manner and enjoy a good yield, so that she can make more money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy potash for her farm and to repair her house.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 39 years old, a married woman who lives comfortably with three of her children in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a hard-working woman with strong ambitions to move forward in life and to be happy. 
She has utilized her first loan to increase her capital. She is applying for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB to buy a variety of cosmetic creams, shampoo and make-up to use for her business. She thanks for funding in her previous loan.

loans.use: to invest in buying a variety of cosmetic creams, shampoo and make-up, artificial hair and combs for her business.

loans.name: Pach's Group

texts.en:
Pach is a 62-year-old widow residing in Pursat province’s Kror Kor district. She is a local farmer who grows rice as the primary source of income. The business that she has been with for 48 years returns her about 23,700 KHR per day.

Including this cycle, Pach is the six-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has succeeded in using the past loans wisely to support her business and has completely paid back the loans already. 

Now, she is the leader in a group of two female members including her. She is seeking 1,000,000 KHR, while her co-borrower is seeking 150,000 KHR. Pach is going to spend her loan portion to buy fishes for resale and to connect the electricity for her house. She hopes that this connection will supply sufficient electricity for her household so that her child can read a book easily at night time.

loans.use: To buy fishes for resale and to connect the electricity for her house.

loans.name: Noun

texts.en: A single woman living in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Nuon is 32 years old and makes a daily living through rice growing and vegetable growing (cucumbers, beans, and wax gourds). She is able to earn up to 17,300 KHR per day from the current businesses that she has been involved in for 20 years. The past loan was her original loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has smartly used the loan, which she has repaid back, to keep up a good pace of her crop husbandry. This is her third loan cycle and she is seeking 4,000,000 KHR. She is going to spend her loan to plow her three hectares of farmland. She hopes that she can grow her rice timely and get back double the yield so as she can grow her business larger than it is now.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fee to plow her land.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, aged 42 and divorced, is from the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. She has four children, only two of whom depend on her as they are still at school. To overcome the family's financial hardship, she grows rice on five hectares of farmland and sells vegetable and meat. She has seven years' experience in this business and is able to earn up to 27,900 KHR per day. 

Mom has never been involved with VisionFund and she is applying for 1,500,000 KHR in order to buy rice seeds. She hopes to make more income from her business so that, in turn, she can set aside some money to further her income by running a small café and a stall at her home which sells grocery items.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds

loans.name: Mab's Group

texts.en:
Mab, age 33 and divorced, singlehandedly supports her two children, both of whom are in school. In order to generate enough income, Mab runs three ventures. She grows rice on two hectares of farmland. She makes and sells small, traditional cakes made from flour and sugar. She also raises pigs and chickens. From her current businesses, she is able to earn up to 17,500 KHR per day. The family lives in a village in the Sampoa Meas district of Battambang province.

Mab has been with VisionFund (a Kiva partner) for the past three loan cycles. The past loans have helped a great deal in injecting capital to ensure the smooth operation of her businesses. She has successfully repaid her previous loans.

For this cycle, she is the leader of a loan group consisting of three female members, including herself. She is applying for a loan in the amount of 800,000 KHR, and the other two borrowers are requesting loans of 1,400,000 KHR each. Mab will use her loan funds to pay for the harvesting and shipping fees of her agricultural output. Additionally, she will use a portion of her loan to buy two more pigs to raise. 

She is confident that she can harvest her crop production in good time and sell it at a high price, allowing her to generate a higher income. This in turn will allow her to expand her animal husbandry venture.

Mab's goal is to support her children's education to the tertiary level.

loans.use: to pay for the harvesting and shipping fees of her agricultural output and to buy two pigs to raise

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun, a resident of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, is 64 years old and a divorced mother of four children. She sustains her family by growing rice on two hectares of farmland. This is her primary source of income.

To better support her living, she also sells Khmer noodles and raises pigs. This business, with which she has been involved for about twenty years, has generated about 18,000 KHR per day. Her previous loan was her first loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. It has stabilized her business and she has fully repaid the loan. 

Now, in a group of four, she is the group leader. She is seeking 1,000,000 KHR, one of her fellow group members is seeking 1,200,000 KHR and the remaining two members are applying for 500,000 KHR each. Oun is going to spend her loan portion on purchasing rice seeds and pig feed. She hopes to run both her businesses smoothly and multiply her income so that she can save some money to set up a small grocery stall at her home for additional income.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and pig feed

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid operates a retail business. He lives with his wife and two children in Sana'a. He is working hard to increase his capital, particularly because he needs to make essential repairs and renovations to the house in which the family lives. 

He has applied for a loan in the amount of 100,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan funds to buy construction supplies to use for repairing his house. 

His goal is to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for making essential repairs to his house

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 32-year-old married man with two children. Most of the money he makes is spent on raising his children and educating them. His house is very old and needs a quick renovation. The house is vulnerable to collapse at any time.

He knows that such a thing needs a lot of money. He has started renovating his house but is now short of money. He needs to complete the renovation task, so he asked for a loan of 120,000 YER to buy construction supplies. He hopes that after the completion of his house renovation he will feel safe in his house with his family.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Temuujin

texts.en: Mr. Temuujin, 33 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in his sister’s apartment. He makes and sells popcorn in his own small shop. He has been running this business for five consecutive years and every customer has high satisfaction with his products. His wife also runs her private business but now stays at home to care for her baby. He has got our loan four times before and repaid every loan on the established schedule. This time he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 tugriks to expand his business by purchasing equipment. As a result, he can generate more income for his family and, in the future, he wants to produce chips. The borrower is a very reliable individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase popcorn machine

loans.name: Toeut's Group

texts.en:
Toeut, 42 and married, is a mother of four children -- two are school-children and the other two are teachers. To survive the daily cost of living, Toeut manages three hectares of farmland for planting rice. Engaging in this business for ten years, she is able to earn up to KHR 10,000 per day. 

This is the second cycle loan for Toeut with VisionFund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner. She has managed her business quite well and it has returned to her a decent income which she can add to her savings to buy a mini-tractor for her farmland. 

Now, she is in a group (Toeut's Group) of two, with a first-cycle borrower. Both of them are seeking KHR 500,000. As the group leader, Toeut is going to spend her loan to pay the harvesting fee. She hopes to harvest her crop on time, so that she can sell it on time during the demand season.

loans.use: to pay for her harvesting fee.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Vien

texts.en: Vien is requesting a new loan to buy a range of clothing to sell. This purchase will help enable Vien to diversify her income-generating activities and supplement the income that she earns from her food stall. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a range of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Fademah - Al-Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
Fademah - Al-Hodeidah group is composed of four women from Al-Hodeidah, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 100,000 YER to purchase food and drinks for resale.

Fademah, a 27-year-old married woman, is the leader of the group. She lives alone with her family as her husband works outside Yemen. She wants to open a school cafeteria and sell sandwiches and drinks for the students, but she doesn’t have enough money. She therefore applied for a loan amounting to 40,000 YER. Fademah hopes she will be able to earn a considerable profit to pay for her living expenses, and those of her parents.

loans.use: to pay for buying food and drinks for resale

loans.name: Al-Huda Group

texts.en:
Al-Huda group consists of four women from Al-Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER to purchase ice creams for resale. Aisha, a 25-year-old married woman from Al-Hodeidah, is the leader of the group. She is the mother of five children and the breadwinner of the family. Two years ago, she started up her business in selling ice cream after her husband became incapable of working. She had no choice but to work and provide her family with food and clothing. Despite her young age, she managed to succeed in the first business of her entire life.

Al-Hodeidah Governorate is one of the warmest cities in Yemen and therefore most of the residents buy ice cream daily. Aisha wants to start selling ice creams in new quarters and places in her city, and this is why she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER. Aisha looks forward to improving her family's living conditions and buying a new fridge.

loans.use: to purchase ice creams for resale.

loans.name: Yis

texts.en:
A diligent farmer from Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Yis is a 59-year-old married mother of four children. To earn a daily living, she and her husband have been growing rice. She has been engaged in this business for thirty years. For her, the main challenge are the floods that destroy her crop output. The current business earns her about 36,000 KHR per day and allows her to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Yis has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She will use a portion of it on labor costs for plowing the field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Son

texts.en: Son is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying a variety of gym equipment to better satisfy her customers. This will enable Son to diversify her income-generating activities and supplement the income that she earns from her food stall. Son's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of gym equipment.

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en:
A rural villager located in Battambang province’s Sangke district, Savorn is 33 years old and a widowed mother of one daughter. Savorn is a rice farmer and a pig-raiser who has been involved in these businesses for 10 years. 

Savorn has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family with enough food. 

Now she is requesting a new loan from VisionFund to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She will also use a portion of it to buy piglets to raise. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en: Suong is requesting a new loan to purchase more food to sell in her stall. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. She will also purchase a motorcycle for transportation. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, which would help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell and a motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Al-Atsam 2 Group

texts.en:
Al-Atsam 2 group consists of three women from Al-Hodeida, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 80,000 YER to purchase clothes, perfumes and incense for resale.

Om-Al-khair, is a 46-year-old married woman with six children. She is  an elementary school graduate. Her family can't afford to pay for all their living expenses: food, rent, school fees, etc. 

Five years ago, she decided to be a door-to-door seller. She has been selling clothes, perfumes and incense. Om-Al-khair asked for a loan of 30,000 YER to purchase more clothes, incense and perfumes for resale. She hopes to earn profits and open a school cafeteria.

loans.use: to purchase incense and perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung is requesting a new loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and other materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish. Nhung's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and other materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of products, such as sugar, confectionery products, and basic household necessities, to increase the inventory of her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and to offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store, to increase sales, and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sugar, confectionery products, and basic household necessities for resale

loans.name: Lot's Group

texts.en:
Lot is married, has two children, and resides in a local village of Battambang Province’s Moung Russey district. She and her husband have been growing rice and sesame to support their family. She is able to earn up to 19,000 KHR per day from her current business, an activity that she has been in for five years. The main challenge for her farming business is drought.

Lot has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle, while the other group member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Lot's past loan, which she fully repaid, helped her to relieve her family’s burdens and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group of two, to ask for a new loan. As the leader, Lot will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for her farm. She hopes to increase her crop yield, which would result in a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Rem's Group

texts.en:
Rem, a local farmer from Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, is 50 years old and has five children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. To support her household, she plants rice on six-hectares of farmland and sesame on two-hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for ten years, Rem is able to earn about 28,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Lack of working capital is the main challenge for her planting business. 

Rem’s group is composed of two members who live in the same village. She had a first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay labor costs of harvesting rice. She hopes to get a high crop yield from her paddy as well as her sesame so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay labor costs of harvesting rice.

loans.name: Chanthol's Group

texts.en:
Chanthol is a 27-year-old married mother who lives under a thatched-roof house with two children. She has been making a living through rice cultivation and sesame planting for five years while her husband works for others for a fee. She is able to earn up to 22,500 KHR per day from the business. The main challenge for Chanthol is the drought which has lowered her crop production.

Chanthol has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Her past loans, which she has paid back completely, have helped her to relieve her family’s burden. She is now leading her group of three to ask for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. Chanthol, the leader of this group, is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her cultivated land and use a portion of it to spend on the labor cost of rice-harvesting. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and seeds for her cultivated land.

loans.name: Hefseba Group

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her mid-20s, is married with two children who go to school. She has been running a cafe for five years now. She works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mary's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock the cafe's missing items, started a new business selling fabrics and liquid soap, paid household expenses, and has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a new loan to buy more stock for her cafe, and to buy more fabrics and liquid soap. Her dream is to be able to build her own house one day.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group "HEFSEBA" who has a total of 16 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her cafe, and to buy more fabrics and liquid soap.

loans.name: Bodiel's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois dont fait partie ce groupe existe depuis le 16 décembre 2011. ledit groupe compte 39 femmes qui habitent le même village, elles ont comme principale activité la transformation des produits de mer et le petit commerce. 

Binta Abdou, l'emprunteur en vedette est âgée de 28 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants; elle fait de la transformation des produits de mer au quai de sa localité. Elle est debout à droite habillée d'un survêtement bleu-blanc et a levé la main gauche.

Chaque jour elle achète 03 caisses de poisson à 5000F francs l'unité qu'elle revend et une partie elle le transforme en poissons fumés.

Son prêt lui servira à acheter plus de caisses de poissons à fumer afin de maximiser ses bénéfices.

Avec ses bénéfices elle souhaite les  recycler pour gagner plus de revenus et renforcer ses épargnes pour atteindre une autonomie financière .
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois to which this borrowers’ group belongs has been in existence since December 16, 2011. This group is composed of 39 women living in the same village. Their main business activity is processing seafood as well as retailing.

Binta Abdou, the star borrower of the group, is 28 years old. She is married and has four children. She processes seafood at the seaside in her village. She is standing on the right wearing a blue and white sweater, raising her left hand.

Every day she buys three cases of fish at 5,000 West African francs each. She resells part of it and smokes the rest. Her loan will help her buy more cases of fish to smoke in order to maximize her revenues. She would like to reinvest her revenues in order to increase her earning capacity and bolster her savings, so as to be financially independent. 
.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Ghulam-Zaineb

texts.en: Ms. Ghulam-Zaineb is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been running a small general store in her community for the last 10 years. Her husband earns an average income by working on a wheat grinding machine. She initiated her business to contribute to the family income. To fully stock her store, she needs to purchase stocks of rice, sugar, and grains. For this, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. Buying more stock will help her to generate extra revenue to meet her business and family requirements.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice, sugar, and grains.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last 20 years. Her husband earns daily wages but his income alone is not sufficient to support his family, so Parveen decided to support her family. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all financial matters. She wants to expand her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy stocks of rice, flour, and cooking oil from the market at lower price. Buying goods will help her to generate extra revenue to meet her business and family requirements.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, flour, and cooking oil from the market at lower prices.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last ten years. She offers various goods for daily use including grocery items and cleaning products. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. Razia is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy stocks of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has excellent repayment history. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is a 43-year-old married woman who has been hand-embroidering from her house for 10 years. She embroiders for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to financial problems, Kousar is unable to meet the daily demands of her good customers. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 35,000. She intends to use this loan to buy raw material including frames and spools of thread with packs of sequins and glitter in various colors. She is in her seventh loan cycle with good repayment history.  Kousar hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to buy raw material including frames and spools of threads with packs of sequins and glitter in various colors.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en:
Hameedan is a 44-year-old married woman who has been selling and purchasing animals for 22 years. She is a mother of four; all of her children are in school. Her husband is a government employee and earns insufficient income to meet the needs of the family. This compelled Hameedan to start her business to bear the educational expenses of her children and pay for other home expenses. 
She purchases small goats and sheep, then looks after them and sells them near the festival of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She makes enough through this business. For the purchase of two small goats, she has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of it on the betterment of her family members. She dreams of providing quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase two small goats.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Ms Musarat is 54 years old and married. She has been doing a clothing trading business for many years. She purchases clothes in bulk from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. Most of her clients are her neighbors and she is making enough to lead a decent life. Her husband is employed in a small retail store but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of his family members alone. Musarat is contributing very much to the family income to support her family through all her hard work. Her customer base is diverse and varied. She is much in demand and highly appreciated among her customers. However, due to low cash in hand, she is facing difficulties in fulfilling the demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to add to her inventory. She aspires to save money for the expansion her business.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs

loans.name: Zaheen

texts.en:
Ms Zaheen is 27 years old and married. Her husband has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years. The man shown in the photo is Zaheen’s husband. He offers various items of goods for everyday use. He has good communication skills and counts a good client list.
  
Zaheen is a mother of three children all of whom are school going. She is motivated to provide for family. For the improvement of her husband’s business, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000/- to buy a stock of rice, flour and packs of oil in large quantity to meet the increasing demand consistently.  She wishes to spend part of the revenues for her children’s education and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour and oil in large quantity

loans.name: Kotiya

texts.en: Kotiya is a 20-year-old married woman and a mother of one child. She has been tailoring for the past eight months. Her husband is a government employee. She accepted the fact that if only her husband works, he will not be able to meet the expenses of household. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family as well. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has requested a loan of PKR 10,000 to purchase a new sewing machine with more spools of thread in various colors. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand of her customers consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Kotiya hopes to grow her business through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with more spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Ms. Fatima is 41 years old, a married woman and a mother of three children. She is an active and talented lady who excels in work of stitching. She has gained 18 years of experience in this field and has a number of loyal customers who prefer her stitching.  She needs to contribute to the family income to provide good food, shelter, health and education to her children.

For the improvement of her business and to meet orders on time, she requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy a new automatic stitching machine with reels of thread in different colors to meet the increasing demand without delay. She dreams of her children's bright future and desires to spend part of her income on improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a new automatic stitching machine with reels of thread in different colors.

loans.name: Sumeira

texts.en:
Ms Sumeira is a 28-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small beauty parlor in her community for the past eight years. She is a good beautician and has great skills in the field of makeup. Her husband works in a laboratory, but his income is not sufficient to meet daily expenses. She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide for her family.

Because she wants to grow her business, Sumeira requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy cosmetics, packs of hair treatment, and skin care products from the market, in quantity, at low prices. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand for her services consistently. She is in her second loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her profit to deal with personal expenses, and part to increase her business capital

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, packs of hair treatment, and skin care products from the market, in quantity, at low prices.

loans.name: Al-Khansa Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Khansa. It consists of 5 ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a 220,000 YER loan from AMB.
Nagla is 24 years old. She is the leader of the group. She is uneducated, living in a poor area in Sana`a. Her house is very old and in poor condition. She needs to furnish her house, but now she short of money, so she has asked for a loan of 40,000 YER to buy furniture. She hopes to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her house.

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en: Ms Mukhtaran is a 41-year-old married woman. She is doing the business of crockery selling with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Mukhtaran’s husband. They have gained three years of experience in this field. They offer steel plates, pots and saucepans in various sizes and make enough to lead a decent a life. The couple has six children; one of them is school going. Mukhtaran dreams of providing a quality education to the other children as well.  For the improvement of their business, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy more dinner sets, bowls and cutlery. In this way, they will be able to cater to more customers time after time, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy more dinner sets, bowls and cutlery.

loans.name: Yola

texts.es: La Sra. Yola tiene 26 años tiene un hijo que tienen la edad de 6 años, ella se dedica a la confección de chamarras ella vive en la localidad de Batallas donde también se encuentra su taller, ella se dedica a esta actividad hace ya varios años,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Yola  utilizara este préstamo para compra de maquina over para la confección de sus chamarras, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital de trabajo, La Sra. Yola enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir mejorando la calidad de la confección de las prendas de vestir y también un reto es la distancia de la localidad a la ciudad de El Alto donde tiene que trasladar sus prendas terminadas para la venta y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir aumentando  su  capital de trabajo su deseo para su negocio es crecer y confeccionar variedad de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Yola, 26, has one son aged 6. She makes chamarras, similar to ponchos, for a living and lives in the town of Batallas, which is where her workshop is located. She has worked in this trade for several years and this loan is her first cycle within the institution.

Yola will use the loan to buy an overlocking sewing machine for sewing her chamarras and she is requesting the loan as she does not earn enough from her work. 

Yola faces challenges in her business, such as continuing to improve the quality of her products and overcoming the challenge of the distance between her home and the city of El Alto, where she must take her finished products to sell them. She is going to use the profits to continue increasing her output. Her wish is to expand her business and make a variety of items of clothing.

loans.use: to buy an overlocking sewing machine.

loans.name: Al-Rhma Group

texts.en:
Al-Rhma Group is made up of five women who live in the same neighborhood in Sana`a, Yemen. They requested a combined loan of YER 180,000 as financial support with the aim of expanding their businesses. 

Suadh is 38 years old, married, with three children, some of whom attend school. She is a tailor. This business allows her to meet her needs without much difficulty. She obtains her supplies at a market in the city. She requested a loan of YER 40,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy sewing items, to expand her business. The extra income generated as a result of this loan will help in easing the payment of school fees.

loans.use: to buy sewing items, to expand her business.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es: La Sra. Ignacia tiene 48 años y es casada con 1 hijo que tiene la edad de 8 años,  ella se dedica a la elaboración de riquísimos postres ya sea horneado y también helados, se dedica a esta actividad hace ya bastante tiempo ella vende sus productos en la localidad de El Torno, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Ignacia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos como harina, polvo de hornear  y esencia para la elaboración de sus postres, la Sra. Ignacia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, su deseo es tener una pastelería donde pueda ofrecer sus postres y jugos naturales.
texts.en: Ignacia, 48, is married and has an 8-year-old son.  She works making very delicious desserts; some are baked and some are cold.  She’s been in this activity for some time now and she sells her products in El Torno.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Ignacia will use this loan to buy ingredients like flour, baking powder and flavoring agents to make her desserts.  The business challenge Ignacia faces is to rise out of poverty and she’ll use profits to improve her and her family’s quality of life.  Her wish is to own a pastry shop where she can sell her desserts and natural juices.

loans.use: to buy yeast, flour and flavoring agents.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Sra. Lucia tiene 36 años y es casada con 4 hijos que son de las edades de 1, 10, 12 y 17 años,  ella se dedica al comercio de chuño, Quinua, tunta y kaya estos son cereales deshidratados, su tienda se encuentra en la comunidad de Cullucachi de la ciudad de El Alto, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Lucia  va a usar este préstamo de para compra por cargas Quinua, chuño y caya por su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo ya que esta época tiene mucha venta, la Sra. Lucia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, ella va a utilizar los beneficios es seguir incrementando su mercadería, la Sra. Lucia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Lucia is 36 years old, married with four children who are 1, 10, 12, and 17 years old. She works selling freeze dried potatoes, quinoa, and the dehydrated grains known as tunta and kaya. 

Her store is located in the community of Cullucachi in the city of El Alto. This is her second loan from the institution.

Lucia is going to use this loan to buy a load of quinoa, freeze dried potatoes and dehydrated grains for her business. Her reason for asking for this loan is to increase her working capital as this is a season of high sales.

Lucia faces challenges in her business such as competition. She is going to use the loan proceeds to continue buying merchandise.

Lucia is a hardworking person who feels happy for the opportunity given to her by the granting of this loan.

loans.use: to buy quinoa, freeze dried potatoes and dehydrated cereals to sell

loans.name: Al-Fares Group

texts.en:
Fares-Al-Hodeidah is a four women group from Al-Hodeida, Yemen.  They applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to purchase women's clothing, perfumes, and incense.

The group’s leader, Heleima, is a 31-year-old married woman with three children.  She completed elementary school but did not continue because she got married at a young age.  Her husband's monthly income is not enough to cover all living expenses, especially food and rent.  Therefore, she wants to start a small business to help her husband.  She wants to sell women's clothing, perfumes, and incense door-to-door.  She asked for a loan in the amount of 15,000 YER.  Heleima hopes that this business will make a profit and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, and incense.

loans.name: Moshera Group

texts.en:
The Moshir group consists of 4 ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen.  They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER.

Najiba is a 34-year-old married woman who lives in Sana`a, Yemen.  She works hard to offer a good life for her family.  She has some money to buy a home appliance for her kitchen but it is not enough, so she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB.  She hopes to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy a home appliance for her kitchen.

loans.name: Nefi

texts.es: El Sr. Nefi tiene 21 años el se dedica   a la ventra y crianza de ganado vacuno, el tiene su terreno y casa en  la localidad de Vinto Chico de la ciudad de Cochabamba, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Nefi va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción ya que desea hacer refaccionar los ambientes donde se encuentra su ganado, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de estos materiales, la Sra. Nefi enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad en la alimentación de su ganado,  su deseo es poder tener una granja donde pueda criar cantidad de ganados para que de esta manera pueda mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Nefi, 21, works buying and selling cattle.  He has his land and his house in Vinto Chico in the city of Cochabamba.  This loan is his first sequence in the institution and Nefi will use it to buy building materials to repair the corrals he keeps his cattle in.  His reason for requesting this loan is lack of capital to buy said materials.  The business challenge Nefi faces is improving his quality of life and he will use profits to improve the quality of his cattle’s feed.  He wants to have a farm where he can raise large herds of cattle to improve his economic stability.

loans.use: to repair the animal corrals.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Sra. Irene tiene 47 años y es casada con 6 hijos que son de las edades de 25, 23, 21,18,13 y 10 años,  ella se dedica a la artesanía ella elabora canastillas de la planta de tocoro,  ella realiza sus trabajos en su mismo domicilio que se encuentra en la comunidad de Palcoco camino Condoriri, es un trabajo muy moroso ya que todo lo realiza manualmente,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Irene va a usar este préstamo para la compra de tocoro para la fabricación de canastillas ya que tiene mucha demanda por su negocio,  la Sra. Irene enfrenta retos en su negocio que son generar mejores ingresos y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su producción.
texts.en: Irene, 47, is married and has six children who are 25, 23, 21, 18, 13 and 10 years of age.  She’s a craftswoman; she makes little sedge baskets at home located in the community of Palcoco on the way to Condoriri.  It’s very painstaking work because it must all be done by hand.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Irene will use the loan to buy sedge to make the little baskets since demand for her crafts is high.  The business challenge Irene faces is generating higher income and she will use profits to continue improving production.

loans.use: to buy crafts-making supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 17 quintals of chicken feed, building supplies to expand the farm and supplies to make hammocks.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Ms Khalida is a 23-year-old lady. She had a difficult time after her father's business failed. She decided to work with her brother to support her family for a better future. Five years ago, she began to do stitching work for income, in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is currently in her second loan cycle and has borrowed PKR 25,000 from Kashf. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials, including cloth, spools of thread, lace, and zippers in various colors, to create a means of increasing revenues. This will enable her to generate a more robust income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, including cloth, spools of  thread, lace, and zippers in various colors, with which to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bandr Group

texts.en:
Bandr group consists of three females and one male from Sana`a, Yemen. Each member has their own type of business. They have requested a group loan of YER 110,000 and they will hold each other accountable for a loan repayment.

Fatima is 41 years old and a mother of six children. She is an uneducated woman from a poor family. The income of her husband is not enough to cover living expenses and the rent of the house, so she decided to apply for a YER 30,000 loan from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy a refrigerator to use in her house.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to use in her house.

loans.name: Punte Killman - 32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento PUNTE KILLMAN – 32 está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varon,  la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Martha tiene 40 años con 7 hijos, ella se dedica al servicio del  lavadora de autos que se encuentran en uno de los puentes donde lavan autos de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Martha va a usar este préstamo para compra de instrumento y materiales como valdes aspiradora y tela para el secaco de autos  que le hacen falta para su negocio del lavado de autos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de material de trabajo al mayor, la Sra. Martha enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia ya que hay muchas personas que lavan autos por los puentes y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y su deseo para  su negocio es tener más puestos  de lavados  de autos, la Sra. Martha se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en: The “Punte Killman-32” communal bank has 8 members; seven women and one man.  The bank president is Martha, 40.  She has seven children and has a car wash business at one of the bridges in the city of Cochabamba where cars are washed.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Martha will use the loan to buy equipment and supplies like buckets, a vacuum cleaner and rags to dry the cars that she needs for her car wash business.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to be able to buy supplies at wholesale.  The business challenge Martha faces is competition because there are many people who wash cars near the bridges and she will use profits to improve her quality of life.  He wish for her business is to have more car wash stands.  Martha feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided by granting the loan since this is the only activity she has that makes it possible for her to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Al-Mriam Group

texts.en:
Al-Mriam is a four-member group of women from Sana`a, Yemen.  They have requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 YER to buy cosmetics and clothing.

Ashwaq is 33 years old.  She only knows how to read and write.  She is a housewife who works very hard and does her best to provide a good life.  Unfortunately, the money she makes is really not enough to buy a home appliance.  Therefore, she asked for a loan of 30,000 YER to buy a washing machine for her house.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for her house.

loans.name: Marta Orquidea

texts.es:
Marta tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera, vive junto a sus padres y sus tres hermanos.  Hace un año instalo una venta de ropa en un local que alquila, recientemente le ha agregado cortes de cabello, tintes, uñas, etc. servicios de cosmetología. Las compras las realiza en la capital del país, viaja dos veces al mes a 150 kilómetros de distancia. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando  a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una silla para realizar los cortes de cabello, entre otras herramientas y equipo para el servicio de salón de belleza. Su sueño, es ampliar el negocio y aperturar otro más para ser líder en la zona.
texts.en:
21-year old Marta is single and lives with her parents and three siblings. A year ago she started a business selling clothing from rented premises and recently added other services: haircuts, colours, nails, cosmetics etc. She buys the products in the capital city, 150 kilometres   away. She travels there twice a month. 

The loan Marta is seeking from Fundación Campo is to buy a special seat for doing hair cuts as well as other tools and equipment for her beauty salon. Her dream is to expand the business and open another salon and thus become the leading beauty salon in the area.

loans.use: buy a special seat for hair cuts as well as other tools and equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy, canned items, meat, eggs, and other items.

loans.name: Félix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 52 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Sus hijos están estudiando y don Félix se dedica a la agricultura desde los ocho años, su padre fue quien le enseño y desde hace seis años se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdos; estos los vende vivos y a veces los destaza (vende la carne). 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar animales para engordarlos y venderlos vivos o destazarlos; la otra parte para preparar el terreno que tiene para sembrar, la cosecha ya la tiene lista; pero no la vende porque el maíz no tiene buen precio. Su deseo es fortalecer su negocio de venta de carne de ganado y cerdos ya que es muy conocido en el lugar en donde vive por su negocio.
texts.en:
Félix, 52, has a spouse and two children.  His children are attending school and Félix has worked in agriculture for the last 8 years.  His father taught him and for the last six years he’s been raising pigs and cattle that he then sells live; he sometimes butchers them and sells the meat.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy animals to fatten up and sell live or butchered.  The other part of it is to prepare the soil he has for planting; he’s already gathered the harvest but hasn't sold it because the price of corn isn't good.  His wish is to strengthen his beef and pork selling business since he’s very well-known where he lives because of his business.

loans.use: to buy animals to fatten up and then sell either live or butchered and also to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Maira Arely

texts.es:
Maira tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera, vive junto a su mamá, un hermano y su hija de cuatro años. Tiene dos años de dedicarse a la compra y venta de ganado, quien le enseño este oficio fue su hermano quien lo aprendió de su padre. 

Los animales los compra, en la comunidad y los engorda por un periodo entre dos y seis meses, luego los lleva al tiangue para venderlos que esta ubicado a veinticinco kilómetros de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando  a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres terneras y dos terneros.  Los cuales espera vender más adelante a buen precio; para brindarle mejor salud, vestuario, alimentación a su hija y a su madre.
texts.en:
Maira, 28, is single living with her mother, a brother and her four-year-old daughter.  She’s been working for two years buying and selling cattle.  Her brother taught her this occupation; he learned it from their father.  She buys the animals in the community, fattens them up for a period of two to six months and then takes them to the livestock exchange located 25 kilometers from home to sell them.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy three female and two male calves that she hopes to sell later on at a good price to provide better health, clothing and food for her daughter and her mother.

loans.use: to buy three female and two male calves.

loans.name: Sandra Cristina

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 24 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Ella se encarga de realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa y a vender fresco, yuca, etc. Y ropa de manera ambulante. Su esposo trabaja en la policía nacional civil del país. Para comprar la ropa y los productos para elaborar las ventas tiene que viajar unos 26 kilómetros hasta llegar a la ciudad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar ropa y yuca, entre otras cosas que necesita para vender. Con el préstamo, ella ampliara su negocio, lo que le permitirá recibir mejores ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, como la alimentación, vestuario, educación, etc. Lo que ella desea es que su negocio crezca y construir una casa.
texts.en:
Sandra, 24, lives with a partner and has 2 children.  She is in charge of the housework, and she also has a business selling beverages, manioc, and clothing in the street.  Her husband works in the national police force.  In order to buy clothing and products to make the food that she sells, she has to travel 26 kilometers to the city.

Sandra is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy clothing, manioc, and other items that she needs to make her sales.  With this loan, she will expand her business, and this will allow her to obtain more income and satisfy the needs of her family for food, clothing, education, etc.  

Sandra wants her business to grow, and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy clothing, manioc, and other products to make her sales

loans.name: Vista Verde Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Marìa Herminia tiene 57 años de edad, es soltera. Ella forma parte del grupo de mnombre "Vista verde", el cual está formado por siete socios, los cuales se unieron para poder lograr sus metas planteadas en cuanto al crecimiento de sus negocios.
La Sra. Marìa Herminia, se dedica a la venta de ropa en base a pedidos que le hacen sus familiares, amigos y vecinos, procura con el poco capital que tiene atender a sus clientes para que queden satisfechos con las prendas de vestir que les vende. Ella necesita el crèdito para poder atender pedidos y que al aumentar sus clientes le hace falta invertir un poco mas de capital en su negocio.
Una de sus metas es poder tener un puesto de venta de ropa en un mercado o a lo mejor instalar un bazar en una zona comercial.
texts.en:
Marìa Herminia is a 57-year-old, single woman. She belongs to the group "Vista Verde" (Green View), which is made up of seven members who came together in order to achieve their stated goals of growing their businesses. Marìa Herminia makes a living selling clothing. She fills orders from her relatives, friends, and neighbors. She uses the little capital she has to keep her customers satisfied with the garments they buy through her.
